38845006.review:
I bought this game on sale for $2.50 and finished it completely in 8 hours, including the story, memes, all achievements, and a few short breaks. 

I'm not a videogame expert or a relationship expert, so all I can say is that I enjoyed this story a lot. I think most people would be able to point out some implausible events, but I would argue that they are few and less egregious than in your average visual novel. Most people don't pick up this game for an award winning story; they pick it up for cute lesbians, and [i] god damn [/i] are they cute. On that front, my expectations were more than met.

But what really appeals to me about this game is that it's not just cute, it's [i] classy [/i]. The main focus of this game is a relationship, and maybe I've been reading the wrong visual novels, but this relationship was by far the most normal one I've ever encountered in a game like this. Most anime relationships have some fantasy that they pander to, and this one is no exception, but to me (remember, NOT an expert here), it's a healthy, reasonable fantasy. It's something you [i] should [/i] want for yourself. I thoroughly enjoyed watching these two girls get to know each other, work through their problems, and build trust. 

This game has a patch to add 18+ content, which I highly recommend doing if you are able (just drop the adult.rpa file into steamapps/common/highway blossoms/game). I installed the patch incorrectly and missed the first scene, and after going back with the patch correctly installed, I can confidently say that the sex adds to the overall experience of the game, being both a normal and important part of relationships. Also, frankly, it was hot as fuck and you'd be missing out.

It looks like Highway Blossoms might be getting voice acting soon, too. While I do think that will make it an even better game, I don't know if I'll be able to go through it again without the voices I had already mentally assigned the characters. If you are like me and think that would be weird, you might want to wait until that update comes out. 

Fucking fantastic game. Worth full price, a steal at $2.50. 9/10. Great way to spend a day. Thank you so much!

Tu po prostu cały czas klikamy „dalej”. Żadnych opcji wyboru, różnych ścieżek fabularnych czy choćby „udawanego” zaangażowania w historię.
Zdaję sobie sprawę, że to nie do końca wada, ale fakt że nie lubię tego „gatunku”... Z drugiej strony  zarówno gry z wyborami jaki i „symulatory klikania” noszą tag „visual novel” i czasem trudno rozróżnić co się dostaje.

W każdym razie, gra nie dostaje negatywa za „gatunek”, ale za cyrki z achievementami. Na forum są różne „magiczne” sposoby odblokowania zacinających się osiągnięć, ale po trzecim przeinstalowaniu gry, kiedy się dowiedziałam, że prawdopodobnie powinnam znów przejść grę (czyli przez godzinę bezmyślnie przeklikiwać dymki tekstu, bo opcja „skip” nie działa bez save'ów), stwierdziłam, że szkoda zachodu, a devowie powinni to naprawić, a nie tłumaczyć graczom jak negocjować z ich zepsutym kodem.

38727502.review:
Had this game sitting on my wishlist for a little while now and never really got around to buying it until now. I went into the game expecting it be similar to most Visual Novels you find around. A short, yuri, story with some nice CG to keep me entertained for a little while. No real expectations beyond able to keep grammer in some shape and a story that doesn't sound extremely forced. 

What I got was a roller coaster that caught me completely off guard. 
- Believable characters which had their own personalities and faults
- Constantly changing scenary that isn't always the same reused backgrounds
- Constant changing of character expressions, movements and lighting
- Character development
- Emotional hits that struck deep
- Comedy that was well placed
- Character build-ups
- Very good, hookable story
- More (not spoiling everything)

This game has a nice pace, and from someone who almost always can't stand a games background music, I thoroughly enjoyed the soundtrack. Unlike other VN's, Highway Blossoms does a great job of hooking the reader, keeping them entertained, and playing with their emotions once you've become invested enough. You can become invested in the characters and want to see what'll happen. It mixes greif and love very well and shows the struggle that can come from said mix. 
[u][b]However, I must say to those who enter into the game, beware, if you have lost someone dear to you, this game, whether intentionally or not, has a way to pull those strings, which I found the hard way.[/b][/u]

36684376.review:
The [u]romance[/u] felt very natural, not as suddenly or out of raging hormones, they compensate each other so good. ♥
So are the thoughts of the protagonist, as she makes clear how she struggles with her loss. A really developed character.
I recognized a lot of personality traits in both characters, which made it even nicer. Also, I really liked how Amber is not a typical 'oh no, I broke a nail' girl. While Marina cheered me a lot of times! ^.^
Most visual novels just use some random [u]music[/u] that fits the ambiance at that moment and is never used again or too repetitive. While here it is really linked to the events, linking moments with the same ambiance. I think this worked great. If I hear one of the songs, I remember the ambiance and some of the events.
The story was also pretty [u]unique[/u], I didn't feel like I was reading a typical love story (again xd) at all. ♥
I wish all visual novels felt as [u]realistic[/u] as this one.
Also it took me way longer than the estimated time. (14h) xb
I definitely want to read everything again once the voices are ready.
Bought it for €0.69, but I think I'm going to buy the soundtrack. I feel ashamed I didn't pay more because it was [b]definitely worth it[/b]. :)
Honestly, I hope AlienWorks makes more like this, that would be so awesome! \(^o^)/

36488153.review:
[h1][i]- "Cosa sei, tu, per Rio?"
- "La sua amica. La sua ragazza. Sua madre. Uno spirito affine. Perché le persone vogliono racchiudersi in categorie?" [/i]
Haruno Nanae, Pietà [/h1]

Diversi mesi fa HumbleBundle rilasciò un bundle chiamato Sekai Project che includeva alcune VN famose come Nekopara, fault, Root Double e altri ancora.

Tra questi vi era Highway Blossoms, una Kinetic Visual Novel (ovvero una VN senza scelte) ambientata nel Nord-America (in particolare nella zona chiamata Four Corners, che include New Mexico, Colorado, Utah e Arizona). Si tratta quindi di un'ambientazione molto atipica nelle Visual Novel (da rimarcare che è di produzione occidentale ma utilizza il famoso stile asiatico per i personaggi) e fu proprio questo ad accendere il mio interesse.

Qui siamo Amber, una giovane ragazza che è in viaggio con il suo vecchio camper verso la California per assistere ad un festival della musica. Durante il viaggio si imbatterà in Marina, una giovane ragazza con la sua macchina in panne. Un po' mossa dalla pietà e un po' per non lasciare sola Marina nel mezzo del deserto, Amber le offre un passaggio fino alla prossima stazione di benzina. Qui si verrà a scoprire che Marina è partita da sola con la macchina del fratello, senza avvisare nessuno per cercare un tesoro appartenente ad un ex-minatore. E quindi così inizia il viaggio di Amber (che sarà molto scettica a proposito) e Marina nei Four Corners alla ricerca del tesoro.

Si tratta di una VN molto ben scritta, passionale e intensa, anche se la trama in alcuni punti appare un po' prevedibile, è fatta bene e narrata in modo realistico, senza avere quella sorta di "Anime/Manga logic". Infatti più di una volta con le varie situazioni (alcune esilaranti) mi sono ritrovato a vedere i miei pensieri riassunti da Amber. 

È presente anche una patch 18+ ma che fortunatamente non trasforma il gioco in un qualcosa di esageratamente osceno, ma semplicemente sblocca delle scene di sesso passionale.

Sia la grafica sia le musiche sono apprezzabili e ben fatte. Inoltre completando il gioco (4-5 orette sono sufficienti) si sblocca una sorta di NG+ chiamata Goofball mode che rende la VN più divertente e stupida. Si tratta di un simpatico extra che vi prenderà poco tempo e strapperà più di una volta un sorriso sulla vostra faccia.

L'unico difetto che ho trovato nella VN è un po' l'inizio, che ho trovato un po' noioso. La VN evidentemente ha bisogno di tempo per ingranare. Ma a parte questo è una VN che consiglio se apprezzate le VN, se siete fan dello yuri e del genere On-the-road.

Voto: 6.5

36406273.review:
Highway Blossoms is illegally good. In fact, it's become one of my favourite visual novels ever, and for a product priced at a mere £7 that's exceptional.

A lot of what makes it work is the central protagonists Amber and Marina. Amber's realism focused persona capable of poking fun at everything contrasts well with Marina's energetic marvelling at the world. The relationship that develops between the two is amazing and I found myself rooting for them at every given opportunity. The pair are supported by other interesting characters too. Even Mariah, who the story designates as the resident bitch, is surprisingly likeable and important to the story.

Admittedly, a lot of this story relies on actions that seem insane from a regular person's perspective, but I'm willing to indulge that insanity because it developed into a story that kept me hooked from beginning to end. There was never a point that I considered slow or padded out. Instead events flow smoothly from one adventure to the next and the careful balance ensures that the novel can explore a variety of themes that all tie in well to the backgrounds of the protagonists.

I love the art as well. The character designs not only look fantastic but are distinctly memorable, and the background scenes are varied and interesting frames for the story to unfold in. For a novel where most of the events take place in desert environments they've done well to keep that interesting. The soundtrack is amazing as well, providing a strong variety of tunes in the background and even tying some of that into the narrative. The lack of voice acting is a shame but in no way dulls my positivity about the novel.

So unless you don't like the genre this is definitely something to have in the library.

36376076.review:
Eu realmente tentei ir até o final do jogo, mas não tive forças para aguentar o tédio deste VN. A história é ruim, os diálogos são arrastados e os personagens muito rasos. Apesar da arte ser bonita, ela é estática, os personagens mudam muito pouco de expressão em relação ao que está acontecendo na história. Você acaba focando apenas no texto e existem muitos livros ilustrados melhores.

[SPOILER ALERT]
História:
Temos a Amber, que é a personagem principal, que está dirigindo pelo deserto quando encontra a Marina e seu carro sem gasolina. Por uma questão altruísta, resolve ajudá-la, levando ela para comprar gasolina num posto próximo. Ao retornar ao carro, descobre que este havia sumido e que Marina está sem dinheiro e sem celular no meio do nada (praticamente só com as roupas do corpo). Qualquer pessoa estaria minimamente chateada com a situação, mas Marina é um poço de otimismo e felicidade, dando pulinhos de excitação o tempo todo, quando convence Amber a seguir numa Caça ao Tesouro (?). Ela é o completo estereótipo da mulher gostosa, infantil e extremamente otimista e ingênua. 

Aparentemente, essa Caça ao Tesouro é muito popular, então milhares de pessoas estão andando pelo deserto tentando achar o ouro. E assim, elas conhecem Mariah, outra caçadora de tesouro e alguém que pelo menos tem algum equipamento para isso. Apesar de estar muito mais preparada para escavar ouro por aí, Mariah veste um estúpido casaco aberto com a parte de cima de um biquíni, com certeza uma roupa adequada para o deserto (sqn). Esta personagem é muito sexualizada, de um jeito que até ofende a inteligência do jogador. Ela é rival da Amber, o que é algo meio forçado na história, parecendo aquelas rivalidades infantis de adolescentes. 

Basicamente, Amber e Marina ficam andando pelo deserto, achando os pedaços do tesouro, o que também parece muito falso, assim como todo o resto da história. No meio disso, tem o envolvimento das duas, que também parece meio forçado, admitindo que a Marina é basicamente uma criança no corpo de uma adulta e a Amber tenta proteger ela de sua própria estupidez. Mas é o otimismo de Marina que acaba fazendo elas acharem o tesouro e nesse ponto da história você já dormiu.

[END SPOILER]

Recomendo a todas as mulheres que gostam de mulheres passarem longe deste VN. Existem muitos outros jogos que representam melhor uma relação entre mulheres, onde as personagens tem muito mais profundidade e são menos estereotipadas, além de ter motivações menos estúpidas para agirem. Realmente não entendendo todos os reviews positivos para um VN tão ruim, é quase como se não fosse o mesmo jogo que eu joguei.

36190580.review:
This is a lovely game. I went into it with the handicap of [i]really[/i] not liking anime style art, but within the first ten minutes or so, the art style became irrelevant and the story took over. It's not particularly surprising in its plot or ending, but that doesn't matter. What does matter is the realism of the developing relationship between Amber and Marina, and their interactions with the other characters in the story, the little twists and turns. It's a love story, but it's also about grieving and letting go, trying to help others, taking advice no matter what the source, accepting people as equals, and most of all about growing up. It is not a "gay" story. The fact that Amber and Marina are the same gender is almost irrelevant. In my case, I'm about as straight as they come, but I had absolutely no difficulty in banging my head against the desk and screaming as one or the other of the girls made exactly the same romatic mistakes as I had done. I ended up wishing almost desperately that they'd make it through.

Did they? Work your way through the story and find out. I don't think you'll regret it.

35936621.review:
[h1] High Speed Flower Bloom [/h1]
[i] “Why is everyone obsessed with lesbians?"
- Scott Pilgrim [/i]
[i] “It’s like lesbianism is a fucking disease around here.”
- FRC Programmer [/i]


Judgement: [u] Worth Full Price[/u]

TL; DR:

So, this might come as strange to some readers, but Highway Blossoms is [i] really [/i] good. No, not in the Nekopara kind of way where the whole point is just to throw “plot” at the player until their dominant hand cramps up (although to be fair the game does have a “Content Restoration Patch” which re-adds the small dose of mostly tasteful nudity into the game). 
Highway Blossoms is a story that truly cares about its characters. Rather than put out the kind of trash (still looking at you Nekopara) that some VN devs on steam specialize in now, Alienworks’ decided to put together an honest to god story about people. The plot does have an overreliance on luck to drive certain parts of the story, but I found myself overlooking that for the character development (and no, that isn’t a double entendre). There’s less than a dozen characters that even have sprites in Highway Blossoms, but each of the main cast members are wonderfully fleshed out in the ~5 hours you spend with them. 
The story shines brightest when focusing on the interplay of loss and love, and the uncertainty that can come from mixing grief with romance. Really, it’s heartfelt and lovely, and tugs at the ole strings at just the right times. If you willing to open your mind and your heart for it, even just a little bit, Highway Blossoms may well wriggle in before you know it. 


Break: I couldn’t think of anything interesting to put here, so this Scott Pilgrim quote from earlier will [url=https://scontent-ort2-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/12744085_506686812825713_7864633856073370842_n.jpg?oh=4e3839aca07bf33c0207e7152d7a88d9&oe=5A7AA039] have to do.[/url]


Soundtrack: [u] Worth Buying [/u]

It’s a smaller soundtrack, clocking in at 26 tracks and a little over an hour, but the music in it is of generally high quality, aside from some small problems with how the music was edited, like some tracks having large amounts of dead air or ending in the middle of a phrase. The music effectively evokes the setting of the southwest, occasionally using a harmonica for that western kind of feel, but mostly using lighter tones coupled with guitars to give a feeling evocative of the open road. The soundtrack is quiet, honestly, but that’s part of why I love it. It serves as a background for the story, and accentuates what’s happening without overbearing you. The stuff by Jake Abernathie sticks out most to me, with his mellow acoustic pieces, but the rest of the soundtrack is good as well, and sitting at around an hour of music for 5 dollars, I think it’s a fine price point. That, and Marina’s Mixtape. It’s so goddamn dumb I love it.



Alright, now I can talk for way longer than I should, in case anyone wants to listen to me ramble.

I found this game indirectly, you could say. Way back in the day, say around 5 years ago, I read a VN called Katawa Shoujo, which to anyone particularly Nippon savvy, sounds like cripple porn. Which it kinda is, but isn’t at the same time. It’s complicated. Anyway, one of the CG artists on KS goes by the moniker of Weee, and the only reason I initially looked at Highway Blossoms was because of their involvement. I know, strange way of picking a game, by a single CG artist, but hey, cut me some slack. 

The point I’m getting at with this was that this didn’t even pop on my radar initially. If I were to see this on the front page of Steam, I’d likely dismiss it out of hand as something akin to the Sakura games, or Nekopara (last mention I swear), basically just porn with more left clicks. Katawa Shoujo had the same perception problem, and was amazing despite its initial impressions. So, on the merit of Weee’s involvement, I gave HB the same time of day that I gave KS. Like I joked in the TL; DR, yes, there is an 18+ patch, but it’s tasteful and at the service of the story. The sexual content in Highway Blossoms isn’t there to entice the reader, it’s there because it has to be. Sex isn’t a reward for figuring out the “puzzle” that is a character’s romance tree, like in Mass Effect. It’s a normal part of most relationships, so removing any sexual elements from a story like this, about a couple falling in love, would be dishonest at best. Plus, at the end of the day, the 18+ patch is entirely optional. I would advise installing it since it’s a part of the narrative, and important to the story in its own way, but it’s not the crux of the story. The game is still worth playing without it.

I could get into the whole “games as a medium, and the place of visual novels therein” thing, but I get the feeling that anyone who’s bothered to read this far into my review isn’t going to be offended by the notion that this game is on Steam, so at the end of the day all I want to say is that it’s worth noting that there are no decisions or branching paths in HB. The game starts, and you begin clicking or set Auto, and read to your hearts content. Depending on your reading speed, this can last you from anywhere between 5-14 hours, but probably more like 6. I personally clocked around 5 hours for the main game, and then spent another hour on the silly extra content entitled “Goofball Mode”, which essentially has them riffing on their own game, and makes a repeat readthrough more interesting. If you’re the busy type, you can always hit the skip button, and the game will stop on any lines of text you haven’t read before, so you can catch the jokes and shenanigans without having to reread the whole story. That’s what I did, but I’m planning on rereading HB anyway, as the music has been stuck in my head for the last week and I just have an itch to spend more time with the characters.

Alright, we’ve hit most of the stuff that I wanted to talk about, but I still have some time left to gush about my favorite part of the game. In many words, I think most people seem to be overlooking one of the stronger points of the narrative, specifically Amber’s struggles with the grieving process. I get it, it’s a mushy romance story, of course the love interest and wooing thereof is the most important part, but it’s the interplay of that with Amber attempting to work through her Grandfather’s passing that was my favorite part of the game. I struggle to put it into exact words without spoiling some things, but I can say this: the grieving process can be very confusing, and trying to find exactly what means what in your head after losing a loved one is a monumental task. Suffice it to say, I think the writing has a lot going for it. Dialogue is well written, Amber’s train of thought is filled with voice and personality, and all the characters are well defined and unique. There’s little to complain about writing wise, aside from some of the contrivances that I mentioned in the TL; DR with certain events being improbably lucky, but it’s a small enough problem that the narrative doesn’t suffer due to it.



At the end of the day, it’s worth noting what Highway Blossoms both is and isn’t:

[b]It is[/b] a lesbian romance novel.
[b]It is not[/b] porn.
[b]It is[/b] a well written story that manages to say something unique about the grieving process, and how loss can affect different people.
[b]It is not[/b] a waste of your money, or time.
[b]It is[/b] very gay.

Highway Blossoms is in no way going to be everyone’s cup of tea. It’s a pretty niche thing really, and I can hardly blame anyone for not wanting to play it. It’s a work of love, of devotion from a small team of writers, animators, musicians, artists, and programmers. It’s cute as hell, and if you’re looking for something to sweeten up your life a little, there’s no better place to do that than the open road.


Give it a read, and maybe give chocolate milk a second chance.


[i] “The L-Word? You mean… lesbian?”
- Also Scott Pilgrim [/i]

35896092.review:
While at first glance Highway Blossoms may seem like a run-of-the-mill visual novel, through realistic dialogue, stunning art, and a killer soundtrack, it far excedes the norm for the genre. 

Telling the story of two wandering strangers on the search for lost treasure and companionship, Highway Blossoms main characters Amber and Marina feel like real people, on a real adventure. The story is packed with emotionaly intense scenes that would abosolutly drag this game down if not for the stellar writing of the main duo. The chemistry that develops between the two is presented through excellent dialogue and visual storytelling. 

The characters come to life with the charming and wonderful art that has clearly been created with care and respect. The art hits the sweet spot right in between overstimulating the eyes and boring the viewer.  The characters tend to contrast well against the sometimes bland desert backround, often providing a great visual spark that is sometimes needed in slower areas of the story. 

Several music tracks in the story are earworms that stay with you long after you've finished a scene. Action scenes create an exhilirating experience with riffing electric guitars and bombastic trumpets that will have you clicking faster and faster just to see whats around the next corner. While more intimate scenes have strumming acoustics and echoing vocals that elicit poignancy. 

A heartwarming and beautiful experience, Highway Blossoms is a story well worth telling and one well worth listening to.

An excellent well scripted, screenplayed, drawn and written story. Highway Blossoms does an amazing job in capturing the beautiful american midwest. 

Highway Blossoms also differs from other Visual Novels when it comes to screenplay. 10 points to the scripter of this game who took advantaged of the Ren'py engine to create a sense of life in the game. 

From moving sprites, to zoom in and outs. Amazingly well done transitions to the opening animated scene. The amount of moving parts in this Visual Novel is amazing, and has really set a new standard (at least for me) when it comes to creating a Visual Novel.

There are some minor flaws about to be listed are minor issues mostly dealing with transitions and the scripting of the game; not the overall art or story. 

While Highway blossoms uses rather cool movements to create life on the stage several issues arrive do to a minor oversight. 

The game use transitions, like most VNs (Visual Novels) as such they can create things like day changing to night. However because the scripter neglected to use a feature called “hard pause” readers may accidentally skip past certain transitions that aren’t meant to be skipped. 

But this is mostly negligible and is up and unless you are spam clicking past text “auto mode” will always prevent this from happening. 
____

So in summery, Highway Blossoms is a well written and thought out game, from the tragic story behind Amber, to the cute and perky Marina. The art is drawn amazingly well even with several artists on the project, the artists don't conflict much with each other. 
The story has an amazing screenplay, adding lots of small details, like moving clouds, sprites moving about and even flying beer bottles! 
 
I highly recommend this game 9.5/10

35615560.review:
Highway Blossoms

Wow, where do I even begin with this one? It surpassed my expectations and before I knew it, I believed in the treasure myself. The treasure being this kinetic novel that was recommended to me and I have no regrets reading it until 5 in the morning. Note: I played this kinetic novel with the official 18+ patch installed.

Characters: 10/10
Absolutely wonderful. Each character has so much depth and in the six hours that you're reading about them, you feel just that much closer to the yuri duo, Amber and Marina. There are quite a few other regular characters as well in the story and they all have their role and contribute a lot to the story. My favorite character would have to be Amber as some of the things she does reminds me of myself sometimes.

Story: 10/10
At first I wasn't too sure about the story. A journey through some American history and landmarks as the girls follow the trail of a long gone prospector, but alas the author manages to spectacularly always bring the focus back to the story of Amber and Marina and the feelings that the two girls develop for one another. You even start to share their excitement as they travel state to state and the story just envelops you in a kind embrace. Just remember, it's always okay to cry.

Art: 10/10
The artstyle was very unique, or at least I thought so. You could feel their expressions and read their faces, you start falling in love with them. And it's not just the characters, the backgrounds, the scenery, and all the details that went into all the scenes made them all the more intimate and deep. Also some of the signage in the backgrounds made me laugh a bit, but it was all cute.

Music: 9/10
The credits music was a great way to finish the novel and honestly the BGM during the scenes was very non-intrusive and fit the scenes very well. All I would say is that you hear some of the same BGM a lot and it just kinda gets drowned out after hearing it for so long. Still, excellent soundtrack.

Gameplay: 9/10
Pleasant UI, everything worked without any hitches, and even the acheivements are enjoyable. You can tell a lot of thought and enjoyment went into making the acheivements. Six hours to complete the main story is excellent. Not to mention that there is a lot that keeps you engaged in the game including new content unlocked after completing the story and acheivement hunting. Sometimes though the menu buttons weren't all very responsive especially in the Extras menu. 

Extra Thought: If you are comfortable with nudity and some erotica, I recommend playing with the 18+ patch. It's very tasteful and in my opinion allows you to feel the girls' relationship on a deeper level. It is in no way a fanservice novel and adds a whole new level to the story. If you are not comfortable, do not worry, you are not missing any story by opting out of the 18+ patch.

This is a very wholesome yuri story that will make you feel all sorts of emotions. Please purchase it and enjoy.

35552296.review:
I got Highway Blossoms as part of a Humble Bundle.  Most of the games in my Steam collection are of the "HULK SMASH!!!1!" variety, and I really had no idea what to expect from this, but figured I'd give it a try anyways.  Well, it sure wasn't what I was expecting.

It was better.

This was my first experience with both VN's (visual novels) and yuri stories (Google what a yuri story is if you don't know).  Wow.  I really came to like the main characters, even identifying with Amber on an emotional level.  This novel-length story (it took me 11+ hours to get through the whole thing, although I am kind of a slow reader) is well-written, tugging at your heartstrings in parts (dammit, who's cutting onions around here??) or making you literally laugh out loud in others.

Desert Blossoms is a story of two young women who meet by chance on the roads of the American southwest.  They go on a treasure-seeking road trip adventure together, and being opposites in many ways find that they each have a [i]lot[/i] to teach each other about life--and love, as their friendship blossoms into attraction and then full-blown love.  Amber, the one too mature for her age and carrying the weight of the world on her shoulders.  And Marina, the naive happy-go-lucky immature ditz (sorry) who could nonetheless bring a smile to anyone's face with her big heart and girlish attitude.  Each navigating the roads of the southwest and of their evolving relationship.  I thought Marina's character was a bit of an anime trope (though I do know people in real life with her attitude and way of thinking), but it played well against Amber's sense of uber-responsibility and protectiveness.

I've never read a romance novel in my life, nor do I have much interest in doing so.  But this story [i]really[/i] hooks into your emotions and had me captivated throughout.  I will probably re-read it in a few months when they release the Remastered version.  (Yay for free updates!)  The story is for the most part PG-13 material, although there is an "adult patch" out there that will add or unlock content not suitable for teh kiddiez.  I just read the regular story though and believe me, it's more than fine without the nudity and hoochee-wawa. ;) If you're on the fence about buying this, do it.  Take a lesson from Amber & Marina and have a new experience unlike any you've had before.

35099184.review:
This was actually *really* good. I've been trying to get into *quality* VNs for a while now and I honestly feel like this is one of the best ones I've experienced so far. I'm not much into romantic stories either, but this really pulled me in and I couldn't help but just feel happy reading through it. This is a kinetic novel, too. For those that don't understand, that means it is *the* "book in digital form" Visual Novel genre. There are no choices, it's a beginning-to-end linear story.

Basiclaly, the premise is that you're driving across the country(The US) to go to a music festival(I assume it's "cochella" or whatever it's called) in California. While driving, you just happen to see a young looking woman waving down people because her car broke down. That's all I'll give you, as a lot more I could say ties into the overall story and what makes it special. The relationship between Marina and Amber was probably my favourite, specfically near the end and how it overall develops, and that's the main point of the story. While I'm not exactly a cassanova that's well-versed in the ways of romance, I felt like the way the story progresses and the way the relationship grows was done very well and came off as believable(or how I'd expect any kind of relationship between two people that care about each other and understand each other would be like). I didn't even find any moment where I stopped and thought "Eh... That's kind of awkward". It was a great experience, especially considering how romantics just isn't my thing at all. I can truly say that the game fully immersed me into it because of how good it was.

The music was amazing. As far as I know, everything was uniquely made for this game specifically. One sing I liked in particular was the credits song, as it really just had a perfect vibe to it with how the story finishes up. I guess a good comparison would be Life is Strange - The music in the game really builds up with nice and atmospheric experience, and it applies to this game too. I often found myself wondering "What if I had a similar experience to this game? What if one day I went out on a roadtrip and just had a crazy experience myself?". Y'know, the usual "I am fully immersed" scenario.

Graphics I always feel like depend with visual novels. It's in the name - "Visual" - so it clearly matters, but at the same time I can't emphasize enough about how much the story is the home-run for this. The visuals were varely well done, especially the intro segment, as it's a moving intro scene. The characters were exceptionally drawn, and I use the word exceptionally specifically because it goes way above my usual standards. The backgrounds were also nice to look at (e.g. the campfire scene, or the race scene). I dunno, not much to say. The visuals are amazing.

Also, adult patch. I really gotta address this. Completely unneccessary to use it unless you consider the scenes important enough to keep in but the story was so good I actually felt guilty using the patch. I didn't even really feel like I needed the context from the adult patch scenes because I had already gotten the gist of why they were important in other more hard-hitting segments.

I guess if I were to suggest anyone to buy this, I'd say that you should expect a simple story between two people and their growing relationship between each other. Making a story that revolves around that premise isn't easy, either. Everybody has their own ideal concept of a "relationship" but I think this game really hit the nail on the head considering what it was working with and in the end I had a nice happy vibe about the game.

7.5 hours played, Pretty descent for $11, but I believe I got it for a lot cheaper.

35095322.review:
Hmm, what to say about this title that hasn't already been said? What words could even do justice to how I feel?

Let's make one thing clear: reading Highway Blossoms was an unforgettable experience.

I can't recall any recent media work I've consumed that has made me as obsessed with it as HB has. My thoughts are overtaken by this story. Replaying scenes in my mind and sighing wistfully at how well done they were. Imagining myself hanging out with Marina and Amber, because they are legitimately loveable characters that I would absolutely want to hang out with in real life (Amber reminds me so much of me, it's amazing). Being inspired enough to cement my plans to get an RV and roam around the highways endlessly.

This was a powerful story, I'm telling you.

I guess I can give this a proper review treatment, too, if my babbling about how deeply this VN touched me didn't convince you to buy it. Seriously, please buy it. When they release the fully-voiced version you'll get it for free, whereas if you wait until after the voiced version releases, it'll be more expensive. I mean, it'd be worth it either way, but it's up to you. But you really should buy this.

Visuals: 8/10
Not really anything to complain about here. Any limitations in how the visuals are done is likely an artifact of how the engine itself works (they use Ren'Py, I believe). The portraits are cute and well done; the characters have enough different expressions and poses that it doesn't feel like they're just copypasted talking heads. The backgrounds are gorgeous, if simple in detail. The text boxes are done nicely, and you can adjust the opacity and stuff if you want to make it more readable for you.

Sound: 9/10
The music in this is excellent. I definitely sprang for the soundtrack so I could listen to it anytime. It always suits the mood really well, besides being great music on its own (Far Between is becoming one of my favourite songs ever). I'm actually listening to the soundtrack as I type this. Once the fully-voiced version releases I'll probably update this to 10/10 (the voices in the trailer are so close to what I imagined for the characters anyway).

Story/writing: 10/10
The writing in Highway Blossoms is so, so good. The story is wonderful itself, but what really shines is how well-developed the main characters become throughout the story. Both Amber and Marina are so likeable and so relatable; I found I was really able to get into both of their heads, so while I didn't always agree with them, I could understand why they did and said the things they did. And frankly, I'd much rather disagree with my otherwise-relatable protagonist and yell at her NO AMBER WHY DID YOU DO THAT HOW COULD YOU OMG than to not understand her decision at all. Even the trio, Mariah included (annoying though she may be), are really loveable characters. The pacing is great, the dramatic tension is built up and released very satisfyingly, and yeah, I definitely cried a couple times. Also, once you finish your first run through, I encourage you to immediately turn on the goofball mode and play it again; the extra dialogue (and extra visuals, I was surprised to note) are absolutely hilarious.

To summarize: BUY HIGHWAY BLOSSOMS. You owe it to yourself to read this. If you like a cute fluffy yuri story with a lot of sweetness and just enough angst, you can't go wrong with this one.

35038612.review:
[i][b]Note:[/b] I [b]have[/b] played and finished the game no matter what the statistics say. For some reason, Steam did not log my playtime (or achievements) the first time around. It happens on occasion when using Steam's Linux client, and manually setting "steam_appid.txt" seems to have enabled the timer at least, but only after the fact.[/i]

Two girls go on a road trip through the American southwest. They meet by chance, become friends, and, eventually, fall in love with each other. 

For the most part, it's a beautiful and relaxed feel-good story filled with fun and likable characters, some adventure, treasure hunting, and lots of real-life landmarks, be it natural wonders or man-made roadside attractions. (It is well worth the effort to keep a browser handy and look up all the locations they travel to for a bit of culture and education on the side.) 

There are some hiccups during the second half of the game when Amber's (our point of view character) internalized angst causes some drama that feels rather forced and unnecessary, but aside from that, the story avoids most of the common pitfalls of the romance genre that I've come to loath ([spoiler]like, say, love triangles[/spoiler]). So kudos for that, and what drama is found in the story never really gets out of hand too much, so I can't really fault it for that either.

Production values, generally speaking, are pretty good for a visual novel. Given that this type of game, for the most part, consists of static sprites standing in front of static backdrops with some nondescript music playing in the background, [i]Highway Blossoms[/i] comes as quite the surprise. There is lots of movement in their sprites, quite a few unusual camera angles, some 3D models of the RV, lots of ambient sounds, and so on. The artwork is pretty good, too, and very accurate compared to the real life locations. (As far as I could tell with the help of my friendly neighborhood search engine, anyway.)

The cast will not be much of a surprise to anybody who is familiar with anime tropes or American stereotypes, but it is used well and even the side characters are portrayed in a very likable and often funny manner. Tess and Mariah, especially, have found a place in my heart and I can't help but hope for a spin-off based on their next adventure.

I haven't played the "New Game +" mode (called "Goofball Mode") yet, but I'm very much looking forward to seeing a sillier spin on the story just as I'm looking forward to the free remastered version that is supposed to be rolling out soon-ish. 

What I'd really like to see though, is a sequel. The ending was very appropriate for a story about a road trip, but the characters clearly have some more tales to tell, some more road trips to go on, and maybe even some more treasure to find.

All in all, and despite some minor hiccups, I highly recommend the game to anyone who likes a nice feel-good story, road trip, or romance and isn't put off by the lack of player interaction. (It is a visual novel in the true sense of the word, foregoing even the pretense of player choice or interaction in favor of just telling its story.)

34949022.review:
Now normally I'm not that into kinetic VNs as I do enjoy some element of choice when playing games. But for some reason this one spoke to me. Maybe it was the art style, or the music, or perhaps the fact that it didn't feel the need to shove fanservice in my face in an attempt to get me to buy it. So, I parted with some money to check this story out.

And what a story it is.

The pacing of this story is perfect, and written so well. The characters are easy to fall in love with; Amber's wit and partial cyncism, Marina's optimism and at-times air-headedness. Even the near emotionless Tess is enjoyable in her own special way. As for the plot itself? It really knows how to absorb you into the tale. I had to know what happened next in the story, so by the time I finished it (in one sitting), it was well past 2 in the morning.

The character art is exceptionally good, and I do enjoy how the characters actually move around the screen when they're being described as moving. The background art is stunning as well, and I love that, with one or two exceptions, each location in the game has it's own specific background. The music is also a big part of the game and I did enjoy just taking a break from the story now and then to enjoy it. If I wasn't trying to save money at the monent, I'd definitely buy the soundtrack as well.

Overall:
While this might not look as flashy or interesting as some other VNs on steam, I promise you'll enjoy hopping onto this emtional and well told ride of a story. Plus, with the devs soon to add FULL voice acting later in the year, it'll defintely add more to this already great VN.
9/10

34912153.review:
This game was absolutely wonderful. I bought it on a sale since I was bored and looking for cute stories to read through someday. It languished in my library for months before I booted it up a few days ago.

16 hours later, I've had such an enchanting time. The game's wonderful soundtrack, thoughtfully developed characters, and themes of sincere friendship and recovery really stuck to me. Kinda expected a "yuri VN" and what I got wasn't that yuri or that VN? As far as it relates to the Japanese ones I'm used to anyway. It's an American story made by American developers about two American girls set in an Americana-heavy roadtrip adventure.

Also, speaking as a queer girl, this definitely felt like a story about queer girls written for other queer girls? Even the sex scenes (assuming you download the expanded content patch, which I greatly recommend) are less about titillation and more about developing their character dynamic and reifying the themes everpresent in the story. They don't feel pornographic at all.

10/10

Came for the cute lesbians, stayed for the heartfelt story of love and loss and love again. Probably the most poignant thing in my entire Steam collection.

34626255.review:
I'll be the first to admit it: When I see that a Visual Novel's made by a western team small enough to count on your fingers and toes, I can't help but be skeptical. The simple opening, the short length, the five-finger soundtrack. For the first few minutes of the game, I was sure my doubts were well-founded.

I was wrong.

Highway Blossoms isn't the kind of VN where you need to map out flags on a piece of paper, or analyze the underlying moral themes or any of that other nonsense. It's two young girls on a quest for gold, and something more. And in this is Highway Blossoms' greatest strength: its simple, honest humanity. 

What is it like to love someone? What is it like to lose someone? This Visual Novel doesn't pretend to have the answers. But what it does offer is a window, a beautifully real glimpse into a relationship in an oddball setting. Is the writing perfect? No. Are the backgrounds and music memorable? Not quite. Perhaps as entertainment, it might be found wanting. As an experience, it certainly isn't. I mean that in the least pretentious way possible. It couldn't change my mind about the desert or country music, but it almost made me cry in front of my roommate. And in my book, that's worth something. 

Highway Blossoms is a game more about love than gold, although there is plenty of both. There are cute girls in it, and they kiss. It's nice.

34620444.review:
I love how this story deals with all of its themes - loss, love, letting go - it's all just very beautiful. I got more out of this story than I thought I would, I got the "game" in a humble bundle, and what peeked my interest was that it was about gay people XD that doesn't even begin to describe it though. I love the characters, even the more annoying ones like the rival, because it would be so easy to simply make the rival a bad guy, but they don't. I love how its the rival that sets things right in the end, it was just well written.
But its more than that - it's about a girl who is trying to deal with losing her grandfather, and how dealing with that is hard and confusing, and she finds solace in the presence of another girl and... and I don't want to spoil anything so just know that I encourage the purchase of this Visual Novel. There are no gameplay elements - you press space of enter to move the story forward - but it still took me 8 hours to get through it, even ending up till late in the night because it was so good :)

一款中规中矩的公路百合游戏。剧情上以“淘金”作为背景，当然你不能期望在游戏中看到卓别林的《淘金记》，也不用期冀能看到《末路狂花》，当然更无可能是杰克·凯鲁亚克的《在路上》。作品本身仅仅就是单纯温馨的恋爱小品描写，仅此而已。[spoiler]（个人愚见认为淘金本身更该作为游戏里的“麦高芬”（MacGuffin）存在，只推动游戏情节。而实际游戏剧情中所展现出的淘金从始至终都给人透露出一股廉价和虚假感。）[/spoiler]音乐表现而言，作为美式GALGAME，本以为能够听到大漠黄沙般狂野的配乐，不过终究是小打小闹，如果偶尔放慢阅读速度，或者是暂时把游戏放置在一旁，游戏配乐甚至会消失。[spoiler] 实际上就是一首歌放完了但是没有循环播放...[/spoiler]不过，我喜欢结尾那段音乐，让人意犹未尽。[spoiler]如果你通过查阅相关资料，你会发现那段音乐来自史逸欣为美国纽约通过同性婚姻法案时而创作。某种意义上与游戏本身非常贴近。[/spoiler]人物塑造上，刻画的角色较为扁平，出场的两位女主没头脑和不高兴有套用人设的嫌疑，而且颇为遗憾的是，整个故事说完，[strike] 作为公路片，[/strike]人物藉由戏剧冲突而产生的成长基本为零。文本技巧上，一些巧妙的隐喻以及较为细腻的对女性心理和动作描写加分不少，也使得文本难度提升不少。

尽管批评这么多，不过我仍然喜欢这部青涩和略带拙劣的作品。我喜欢Marina手足无措时，Amber突如其来伸出的援助之手，喜欢Amber居然同意了Marina那近乎荒诞的寻金请求，喜欢她们在遇到感情问题时的举手投足，喜欢她们在遇人非议时的面红耳赤，喜欢Campfire、The Fire Wave、Gorge时的CG和那些温馨动人的场面。抛开那些性别因素，恋爱本就如此青涩而拙劣，难道不正是我们每个人都向往的吗？[spoiler] 另外，谢谢某人送的游戏。[/spoiler]

[spoiler] 评分：5/10[/spoiler]

34296073.review:
Wow.

Highway Blossoms was my first VN of any kind, and I have to say I didn't know how I'd take to playing a game without gameplay. I was absolutely blown away. I had to take crack to get my mind off of it. The characters, pacing, art and music are all excellent. At first I found some characters to be annoying, but by the end I loved them. At first the music only seemed capable, but then I often found myself ignoring the scenes entirely and just taking in the music. In one instance, the song looped so many times it stopped playing before I had finished the scene. I plan on buying the soundtrack, if only to support these wonderful, wonderful developers.

I want to leave a note about the adult patch, as I did play with it installed. It was one of my favorite parts of Highway Blossoms, but not because it's smut. It doesn't add a lot of content, but what is there is so well-writen and soft-spoken that it felt like it deserved to be there as a part of their story rather than as a bonus to get you off. It, like the rest of this visual novel, is a very human depiction of love and passion with actual nuance, so much so that I was awkwardly crying during one of the sex scenes. It's my favorite adult patch in anything to date. Anyway.

You don't have to play with the patch, it's great. I hope that I can add a bit to the adoration for this visual novel so that others will experience it too, and get these guys on the path to making something new! Highway Blossoms was worth every cent, and I can't wait to see what they come out with next.

34276738.review:
This is the best yuri VN I've ever read. It's up there with best of all of them, actually, now that I think about it. The story is really engaging and interesting even from early on, before it starts to really focus on romance blossoming. When the tone starts to shift, it feels right. Some of the story is a little predictable, but the characters were so likable that I adored every minute of it anyway. Honestly, I kind of liked that facets of the story were predictable, and while there was some tension at times, it seldom if ever felt oppressive. 

It's worth noting that a really big theme of this story is moving on after losing a loved one. It's a subject treated with tremendous care and respect, and I think that anyone who can relate to that might appreciate a heads up before going in. It is pretty emotionally intense. I definitely didn't expect for things to get to me as much as they did, but I very nearly cried a few times at things, and the story definitely provoked a lot of emotions from me ^^

The soundtrack is pretty alright, but I wished there were some more songs. Fortunately, there is a 'remastered' version of this coming soon if I'm not mistaken that fixes that. If you buy it now, while it's cheap, you'll get the remaster patch free, wink wink. 

H-scenes are nice and all, but I think this is one where it wouldn't be bad to skip the 18+ patch. Don't get me wrong - the intimacy in this story is handled quite well. It didn't feel overly fanservicey or anything, and it actually played a pretty important part in the story, so I don't think you're WRONG to get the patch, but I think that this story would still read and play wonderfully with fade-to-blacks instead. 

All and all, this game really tugged at the heartstrings. I really didn't want it to end. I just want to see more cutesy antics between Amber and Marina. :P

34207623.review:
Alright, so I got this game as a part of a visual novel pack on Humble Bundle, and I must say, I don't regret it at all~. :) This game, which I'll admit is the only one I've played, truly was worth it since I don't think I would've discovered it otherwise! :D So, enough of my simplified compliments, let's get into the real meat of this review!

Plot: Amber is a levelheaded, snarky young woman who has been on the road for years in an old camper van her grandfather owned. Less than a year after his death, Amber is on her way to an annual music festival when she picks up a young lady, the sweet, naive Marina, who is on the search for gold that a miner supposedly hid across the Southwestern part of the US. With another group also hot on the trail, this unlikely duo will find more than gold on their travels.

Pros: Simply put, this is a seriously heartfelt game. The story is well done and pulls you in every step of the way. The characters, especially our main pair, are likeable amd sympathetic, even the cantankerous and foul mouthed Mariah (arguably). The gradual building of Amber and Marina's relationship over the course of the story is also fairly believable, going from mere acquiantences to partners, then to friends, and eventually to full blown lovers (yep, in case you didn't guess, this is a yuri game~). Speaking of yuri, is sex scenes, available on steam through a patch, are fairly tasteful and work in the context of the story. And while the treasure hunt is a secondary part of the story, it's still interesting and fun to read along with. As a minor mention, the music in this is very good, though it may get repetitive since there's not a LOT of it.

Cons: In case you don't know, this game is a visual NOVEL. This simply means that you have no input with where the story goes and what happens, not even moving around or choosing to check certain areas. So as a warning, if you prefer traditional games that give you that sense of control, this game is VERY much not for you. Also, if lesbians do not interest you, it would also be a good idea to avoid this.

Final Thoughts: I really can't recommend this enough. The only reason I wouldn't recommend this is if you're not interested in visual novels, especially ones that don't give you any control over what occurs. Otherwise, enjoy the story and especially the characters. Also, if you're considering buying it, just know that within the year of 2017, the developers plan to raise the price as they remaster ther game with voice acting. Those who already own this game before then will get a patch for the game free of charge.

34205546.review:
There are times in life that you find yourself dealing with a lot of hardships. be it the loss of a loved one, a heavy breakup or just dont feel like having a great time altogether. Coping with this kind of feelings is somewhat difficult and there are a lot of good ways of dealing with that, one of them is losing yourself to al sorts of entertainment.

This visual novel addresses this sort of feelings by itself while providing enough escapism for those who just want to escape reality a bit while enjoying a good story. This game treats things in a charming and mature way, it lets you connect with the characters and actually care for them in some way or another. The supporting cast is well written, funny when funny is needed and mature or serious when needed.

Overall I think this game is amazing for its low price even though it is a 5-10 hour long static visual novel. I would recommend this to anyone who is either looking for a good story and/or dealing with some sort of personal issues. I can also add that the fact that this vn is relatively short, it means it is a good starting point for people new to vn's.

tl;dr:Good story, good themes, cathartic, good music. 9/10

34182881.review:
This game is a cute, cheesy, fun and fluffy read that combines a buddy road trip adventure in the American Southwest/West with a love story containing themes of moving on from past sorrow. The main leads play off each other well, and I absolutely adore the all characters, and while I wish there was a bit more variety in the music and the background CGs, I otherwise had a lot of fun reading/seeing this. It's fairly short and I played it straight though from beginning to end in one sitting, lasting me about 4.5 hours. But it delivers in its content, absolutely.

Don't go into this expecting anything particularly deep, angsty, or novel, but don't dismiss it either because of its general lightheartedness. The world could use more cheesy, fun stories like this, especially involving and representing healthy LGBTQ+ characters and relationships.

Okay, I thought having finished the game and really enjoying it I should write a review.

The game is a visual novel, not really any interaction through the whole of it but that is not a bad thing at all since it would detract from the powerful story.
Now I'm not going to give away any spoilers but it takes you on an inspiring journey through Amber who is on a road trip with a purpose. On her way she has a run in with a strange, child like girl on the road in need of help and together they journey on a road of discovery meeting some strange and engaging characters along the way.

The story is powerful and moving but can take some getting into. But once you are drawn in you will want to see what happens next. It does have a yuri/lesbian theme and yes there is a 18+mod but that is missing the point. If you go in for just the yuri you are missing out the point of emotions and development between two people.

All in all probably one of the best visual novels I've come across and would like to see it made into a proper animation.

33943893.review:
[h1] << Highway Blossoms / Воспоминания о прошлом или как совратить на лесбийские отношения >> [/h1]

[h1] Сюжет: [/h1]

Кинетическая новелла относительно большого размера (примерно 8-9 часов чтения), повествующая о том, как надо отпускать прошлоe и встречать будущее (конечно же, если ваше будущее не такое же, как у главной героини). Главная героиня (Эмбер) решает совершить путешествие, но её планы рушит миловидная девушка (Марина). Далее по сюжету вас будут ждать интриги, однополные отношения, драма, ненависть, приключения и плоский, женский юмор, а также прочая батва, спойлерить не буду.

[h1] Мнение о сюжете: [/h1]

Моё мнение весьма просто: я не такой большой фанат женских однополых отношений. Основа сюжета мне понравилась, но то, как это подаётся уже понравилось не так сильно (это не значит, что я сексист или нетолерантный человек! Просто жанр не зашёл). Ну и конечно, если у вас есть задатки женоненавистника, то читать эту новеллу не стоит (в противном случае, вы будете бить себя по лицу в диком приступе facepalm`ов настолько часто, что станете краснее помидора). О сюжете всё, перейдём к деталям.

[h1] Далее в деталях: [/h1]

Визуально, всё выглядело довольно приятно - фоны, CG арты и рисовка самих персонажей выглядят красиво (но элементы с наготой всё же хромают).  Т.к. большая часть новеллы проходит в трейлере, было добавлено небольшое покачивание кадра, что радует.

Музыкальное и звуковое сопровождения также смогли меня порадовать. Всё время звучала музыка каких-то американских стилей (я необразованная деревенщина, поэтому не знаю, что это за стили), что поддерживало колорит пустыни и в целом всю атмосферу.

Особенностей у этой новеллы практически нет, кроме "дурацкого режима" в 2-ух версиях (1 будет содержать небольшое текстовое изменение, делая сам текст ещё более непристойным (и вроде как смешным) и 2, содержащее очень краткую версию сюжета). Стоит ли ещё раз проходить новеллу в этом режиме? Решать вам.

Из минусов стоит выделить только отсутствие официального перевода и поэтому придётся скачать русификатор. Ну и т.к. этот пункт получился слишком маленьким, стоит ещё раз упомянуть про наличие наготы в новелле, карточных наборов и забавных достижений.
  
[h1] Итог: [/h1]

Подводя итог, скажу, что новелла весьма недурна по тех. параметрам и сюжетом (вопрос только в ваших вкусах - зайдёт ли вам подобная тема, аль нет). Ну, а моё мнение однозначно - положительный отзыв и выборочная рекомендация к прочтению сей новеллы.

P.S. буду рекомендовать её своим подругам, авось понравится ^^.

33917100.review: Really charming, sweet love story with a very unique setting in the American Southwest. Albeit a bit cliche at times, the strength of the writing and likability of the characters makes you want to see them get through whatever hardship arises. Soundtrack is great, although I can't seem to find a copy of it anywhere. You can tell the creator has a lot of passion and experience for world building and writing, as all the characters met in states like Arizona, New Mexico, etc. feel like real people that many a southerner have met before. If you're a fan of the Yuri genre, pick it up. If you happen to live anywhere west of Texas, absolutely pick it up. Had me hooked to see it through from beginning to end.

33875177.review:
Highway Blossoms is a good example of what a real visual novel should be, a visual novel. Were most visual novels are filled with dialog of character conversations, this game actually has descriptive writing, pages of story inserts, and a long story worthy of the genre visual novel. Highway Blossoms is a bit long, it took me about 13 hours with full achievements. It’s so long, I had times were I was easily distracted and couldn’t focus.

Highway Blossoms is about two strangers (female) finding each other on the highway. They team up to find a treasure that may not exist while traveling to American national parks and land marks. I can honestly say I learned a lot about land marks. Once the journey is over, the characters are free to further their new relationship. There was one overly dramatic arc that I didn’t care for, in fact an extra character pointed out that her self drama was stupid (I call these situations a Japaneses cheap dramatic cliche and a waste of readers time). In the end, they live happily ever after.

Highway Blossoms made a story mostly based in an RV interesting. No really, most of the scenes were in an RV. Highway Blossoms may not of had the most engaging story, but it sure was a good adventure love story.

33780299.review: Adventure, loss, love, riches, laughs, etc. All things that I wasn't expecting. Another lesbian romance, this time around a girl stricken by grief and her own insecurities, and a girl longing for new experiences. I absolutely love it. It's different and quite frankly, it's needed. With my other visual novels I became used to the stereotypical, hetero relationships. With this and another one that I've played recently, it's interesting to see a relationship between two girls play out, especially when they are dealing with their own, but still very real and valid, issues. It's natural, because it is. I was aware of these relationships existing and of course, I never had a problem with it. I guess I've come to appreciate them more, it was never really about whether I accepted them or not. I was understandably rooting for them, to be completely honest. Cause their difficulties are very much reflected in society. The fact that it is two girls shouldn't matter, but I hate to admit that in this case, it does cause of how rare it is for a platform like this to approach subjects like these. Love is love, but I can't help expressing that my enjoyment for games like these is felt more than most. I know that sounds excluding, but that's not how I intend it. I also seem really preachy right now, but it's important stuff. Games like these shouldn't be rare, or even considered special. That sounds harsh, but I meant that in the sense that it needs to be normalized. Hopefully, this isn't too confusing. I truly admire what video games as a medium can accomplish. Please, if more of these is what it takes to normalize it, then so it shall be.

33623132.review:
Like others have said, this is a yuri kinetic visual novel. That means girl-girl, with an optional patch to enable some "extra" content. It is not needed to enjoy the story, but it is not out of place either. 

I got this VN some time ago during a sale as another game that clog up my backlog. But I remembered reading the reviews and thought it might be a quick, kinetic story that might provide some enjoyment.

I didn't think I was going to like it at first. There's no voice acting, and the music is meh at best; it's borderline elevator music. But the *way* it's written really conveys a sense of realism. The characters are believable, and with one exception (it's not a main character, you'll know who it is) they're all likable. This one really surprised me at how engaged it kept me.

I think the game is worth the current price of $9.99, and it's an easy recommend for anyone who's a fan of lighthearted yuri visual novels. And if you haven't read one before or don't know if you'll like yuri, give this one a shot. I think you'll really enjoy it.

33526518.review:
I really wish I could recommend this VN. As a lesbian woman, we don’t see much productions with queer characters, especially lesbians. Unfortunately, when someone does, it is unrealistic or overssexualized (or both). This review has spoilers.

I didn’t really play many VN in my life but this one didn’t please me much. My advice is to buy only when is on sale and if you really want to play a yuri (girl likes girl) VN that the main characters aren’t sisters or that they don’t die at the end.

First, the event that triggers the story is not convincing. The first hour watching is very boring and gave me the feeling that the story was going to be as plain as the presented premise of the adventure. The main character is a prickly pear that drives a RV (urgh) and the other one is a bubbly sweet, tending to stupidness, girl.

The supporting characters are also plain and very annoying. One of them is overssexualized, dressed in a stupid way: I mean, who is going to use bikini under overalls and let the front part open revealing your body in the desert while driving a RV? I would force myself to buy that style if it was a more beach setting but… no. Pure fan service and nonsense.

The only thing that made me play through the end was the fact that me and my girlfriend made a similar road trip towards that area (but we left from LA) and I felt nostalgic thinking about the places we’ve been. The setting was well written. Ah and of course the story is about a lesbian. The only part of the story that pleased me was after the first kiss until Las Vegas. The main character freaking out because she can’t discern her relationship with her grandpa and the one with her girlfriend was super weird and not convincing. I also have to say that the sex scenes were convincing and, writing wise, didn’t bother me. I was really expecting the worse.

Visually, this VN comes short of the expected. I missed more different reactions and poses, especially for some moments. It would be great if they put more scenes like when they were at the firecamp. I got bothered many times due to the lack of emotion in the drawings. Sometimes I just focused on the text because the imagery wasn’t following the story. The sexualized women characters (Mariah especially) and the sex scene with childish women bodies… wrong.

This is what happens when a guy writes a story about lesbian women.

obs.: I have 10 hours because I left my computer on while doing other stuff... :rolleyes:

33524448.review:
If you're interested in anything but the patch, don't play it. Seriously. 

It's an unbelievably cliched VN with painfully awkward dialogue. The characters are terrible - one is stereotypically bubbly and naive, the other is stereotypically stoic and silent, and after a few hours, I hated both of them. The story itself is predictable, riddled with plotholes, badly written and needlesly drawn out. It reads like a teenager's idea of an amazing and 'deep' romantic adventure, or someone's early attempts at yuri. It's cute, and a good first try, but I really regret putting three hours into it. The art doesn't do anything for me and the music, while OK, was clearly 'inspired' by some well-known songs which I found really annoying. But mostly, I was just really disappointed in the story and the characters - it's a VN, so without a good story, it doesn't have much to offer.

33497609.review:
[h1] Review em português! [/h1]

Não sei se é o primeiro em PT então tentarei detalhar a experiencia que tive com o VN. [b](SEM SPOILERS)[/b]

Comprei um Humble Bundle de visual novels por que queria conhecer o gênero de jogos que recebe tantas criticas e brincadeiras no mainstream. Achei que ia ser horrivel, sendo super sincero. Mas então, me surpreendi! 

Highway Blossoms é um exemplo ótimo de uma história de romance bem contada. Os personagens ficam entre o real e o que você esperaria de um anime... mas isso não é ruim, pois o estilo (se você gostar de anime) te mantém lendo até que você conheça e se apaixone pelos personagens. Eles são memoraveis e nenhum personagem inutil é introduzido na cena. [spoiler] Menos o jumbo. RIP JUMBO. [/spoiler]

A história tem um plot que te mantém curioso, com um ar de mistério a princípio, tendendo a focar na relação das duas personagens principais dai em diante. Você vai ficar emocionado e alguns acontecimentos vão te fazer ler por horas.

Agora atenção, esse é um VN cuja a interação é apenas passar as falas para leitura. Eu achei que ia odiar isso, mas antes de desinstalar dei uma chance e adorei. Vai bem com uma cerveja gelada cofcof.

De forma geral:
Prós:
>>História interessante, com personagens vivos e memoraveis. 
>>Arte muito boa, com uma das melhores ilustrações de personagem que já vi em VN até agora.
>>Trilha sonora boa.
>>'Feels' 

Contras:
>>É uma história curta. (demorei 8h, mas talvez você leia em menos)
>>Só tem em inglês. Sim, você precisa saber ler inglês para entender a história.
>>Alguns artificios usados na criação da história são bem clichê.

Você que julga:
>>Sem interação. "Um livro com audio e ilustração" >Bom pra ler e relaxar. Ruim se quiser jogar um jogo de escolhas.
>>Os personagens fazem uma viagem no meio do deserto do texas e visitam alguns pontos turisticos reais, com infos do lugar. Legal pra quem, como eu, se interessa por essas coisas.
>>Presença de +18 pack opcional. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

33457657.review:
Lot of love for this game. Personally, I just don't see it. The plot is every blend of cliche and campy that you could find in the road trip and romance genres smashed together with Yuri. Lots of lines made me cringe with how well it slotted perfectly into so many terrible road trip and romance movies I've seen before. Because of this the story is predictable to a capital T with me guessing all the beats it was going to take miles before it happened.

The characters exemplify this to an extreme degree. You have the "strong", silent protagonist who's made to face their feelings and open up by the bubbly and cheerful road trip partner. The lead has some tragedy that emotionally damages her and the bond between the pair reaches it's peak, faces the conflict and ultimately resolves with strong-silent finding out bubbly-cheerful was what they needed all along, helped by a loudmouthed gruff no-nonsense anti-hero who shows their vulnerable side to smack strong-silent with some sense.

The music is ok. I couldn't make the music out from your run-of-the-mill royalty free BG music you'd find on a website and was surprised to find out it's all original.

The art is beautiful though. Every scene is very detailed and in high resolution and the character models are incredibly well illustrated.

I applied the nudie patch for my playthrough because I didn't want to miss out on anything *wink wink*. In all seriousness, sex in anything other than porn doesn't really do it for me and I just didn't want to miss out on any dialog that might have happened during the 2 scenes the game has. Honestly, you're not missing much if you don't apply the patch except for well illustrated girls lying on top of each other and doing the Bow-chucka-brown-cow on each other in a couple of poses. Most of it is told through dialog that is honestly not that titillating. I've read "Letters to Penthouse" that were better at stimulating the imagination.

33297735.review:
As a fan of Yuri Manga/Anime, I highly recommend this heartwarming (and heartbreaking) tale. As of yesterday I finished it and the thoughts of the story reoccurred right after I woke up and I just had to right this review to really drive home the fact that this story is excellent. Sure it's no Walking Dead or Game of Thrones in terms of epicness in its story, it's more of a Sasameki Koto or Girlfriends, and if you are familiar with those two names in Yuri then you'll love Highway Blossoms. 

Took me about 8 hours to read through since I take everything in slowly and process it all differently, but you might be different. If you're going in expecting an ecchi romp or a visual novel with loads of fan service and accidental nudity, you might be disapointed (key word here: might). There are two sex scenes and they are certainly not the main draw of this visual novel and that's about the only "ero stuff" that is here, so if you're paying full price for this game just for that then you will probably be disappointed. Having said that, it was well written and does not try to be hentai, if you've read through Girlfriends (a Manga I highly reccomend) then you'll know what to expect here. So yeah it's not supposed to be an erotic adventure, it's not "Leisure Suit Liara" (which wouldn't be a bad idea for a game actually), it's just a great story about two girls falling in love and then after all they go through, have sex twice towards the ending stretch of the game.

And on that bombshell... all I can say is if you like visual novels and the Yuri genre then you'll absolutely love this!

Concerning the story, people who like to have many choices won't like it - since the term "visual novel" here is literal. Personally, I had a few troubles concerning the narration - some words were pretty specific, not something someone whose native language isn't english would understand at first.

33072279.review:
I'd been interested about picking up a visual novel, having not played one before and Highway Blossoms caught my attention, primarily because Yuri and the story description piqued my interest. (Yes I did install the H patch)

I suddenly found myself sucked into the story of Amber, a girl who is trucking through the desert in her RV trying to leave a part of her life behind when she encounter the ditzy yet likeable Marina and the two wind up pursuing a treasure hunt. Throughout the course of the game you see their relationship slowly begin to blossom (HA). The writing is absolutely incredible. I found myself drawn in and actively wanting to see where their story went, getting incredibly emotionally invested and finding myself incredibly satisfied at the end.

The art style was very nice with some simplistic animation (first VN so nothing to compare against) which gave some daft moments as well.

In summary Highway Blossoms offers characters that feel incredibly alive in their interactions and tell a wonderful story. I would love to see a return to the characters of Amber and Marina in a sequel with maybe a larger scale novel perhaps.

8.5/10

32812043.review:
[h1]Highway Blossoms[/h1]

« Highway blossoms » est une Histoire visuelle courte (<10h) et linéaire qui vous emmènera faire un délicieux road trip en camping car dans le sud-ouest Américains. Vous y suivrez l’histoire d’Amber, une jeune fille qui fait la route jusqu’en Californie en mémoire du Grand-père dont elle pleure la perte et de Marina, une auto-stoppeuse qu’elle va ramasser et qui va la ramener à la réalité de ce qui se passe dans la région : une véritable ruée vers l’or. 
Tout a été très bien pensé pour nous donner une réelle impression de prendre part au voyage, de l’histoire où on alterne route et arrêts réguliers, du côté mystérieux et excitant de la chasse au trésor, des paysages et décors de très grande qualité qu’on observe au cours de l’aventure jusqu’à la musique qui nous plonge un peu plus dans l’ambiance. 
On découvre les personnages en même temps qu’elles apprennent elles-mêmes à se connaître et au fur et à mesure du voyage on va progressivement s’attacher à elles et aux liens qu’elles vont tisser entre elles. 
Mon principal regret est sur le gameplay, il y avait un réel potentiel de rajouter des choix et nous faire interagir et participer à la chasse au Trésor par exemple avec conséquence ensuite sur l’histoire. Les personnages secondaires auraient pu être un peu plus développés surtout qu’on apprécie de les recroiser à de nombreuses reprises (probabilité que çà arrive dans la vraie vie ??) 
Çà reste néanmoins une très belle découverte et agréable lecture qui donne envie de suivre les futurs travaux d’AlienWorks.

[h1]En conclusion : [/h1]
Un très agréable road trip qui vous fera voyager dans le sud ouest Américains. Vous y découvrirez de très beaux paysages, des personnages hyper attachants et peut être un peu d’or sur la route alors si vous aimez lire et voyager et que le yuri ne vous dérange pas, foncez, je recommande ! 

[b]Bilan : 8/10[/b] 

 [h1]English summary[/h1]
A really enjoyable road trip that will make you travel through American South-west. You will discover wonderfull landscapes, lovable characters and maybe some gold on the road. Highly recommended if you enjoy reading, traveling and yuri !

32717581.review:
"Love is never easy"

Und vor allem kommt sie selten ohne Zweifel daher und viel zu oft völlig unerwartet. Das trifft auch diesen wundrvollen Girls Love-Visual Novel zu. Kurz zur Story: 
Amber ist eine junge Frau, die die meiste Zeit ihres Lebens mit ihrem Großvater in einem Wohnmobil auf den Straßen Amerikas verbracht  hat. Als dieser dann stirbt, bringt dies ihr ganzes Leben durcheinander und hinterlässt sie ziemlich antriebslos. Auf dem Weg zum Coachella, einem großen Musikfestival, mit dem Ziel, seinen letzten Wunsch zu erfüllen, trifft sie auf Marina, die eine Autopanne erlitten hat. Nach einigem Zögern lässt sich Amber überreden, ihr zu helfen, und bietet ihr an, sie zur nächstgelegenen Raststätte zu fahren. Dort überschlagen sich die Ereignisse: Marina hat ihr Portemonnaie vergessen, Amber erfährt von Marinas eigentlichem Reisegrund, nämlich einer Schatzsuche, und die beiden treffen auf Mariah, ihre spätere Konkurrentin. Da Marina plötzlich ohne Handy, Auto und Geld dasteht, sieht Amber gar keine andere Möglichkeit, als sie zurück nach Hause zu fahren. Doch anstatt den Heimweg anzutreffen, überredet Marina ihre neue Reisegefährtin dazu, sie an den ersten Ort der Schatzsuche zu bringen. Amber lässt sich überreden und als die beiden tatsächlich den ersten Teil des versteckten Goldes finden, ist auch Amber auf den Geschmack gekommen. Auf der Suche nach den anderen beiden Teilen des Schatzes, führt es die beiden jungen Frauen quer durch Mexiko und Amerika, in Nationalparks und sogar nach Las Vegas. Neben vielen, teils interessanten, teils seltsamen, Leuten, stößt Amber allmählich auch auf ihre Gefühle für ihre Begleiterin. Doch das Leben ist ja bekanntlich nie einfach und so bringt auch die Konfrontation mit ebenjenen Gefühlen Konsequenzen mit sich. Gelingt es Amber, sich ihrer wirklichen Gefühle bewusst zu werden?

Hinzu möchte ich erwähnen, dass ich eigentlich kein großer Fan von dem Genre Visual Novel bin. Normalerweise finde ich sie meistens viel zu teuer vor dem Hintergrund, dass man sie nur liest und die Animationen bzw. Standbilder teils nur rar gesät sind. Dahingehend ist Highway Blossoms nicht viel anders. Man kann keine Entscheidungen treffen, man liest stundenlang nur Text und die Animationen hätten manchmal mehr sein können. Jedoch  brilliert das Game mit einer so amüsanten und außerordentlich spannenden Story und mit einer handvoll wirklich interessanter und liebevoll ausgearbeiteter Charaktere und hat mich zehn Stunden lang köstlich unterhalten. Die Zeit verflog rasend schnell und ich konnte kaum aufhören. Die ganze Geschichte war einfach so liebevoll und die Beziehung der beiden Mädchen so authentisch und gar nicht überladen mit Klischees, dass ich vollauf begeistert war von all den Details. Selbst die unzensierten Adult-Szenen wirkten nie too much und waren gut ausgeschrieben. 
Tatsächlich würde ich sogar sagen, dass dieser VN das Geld wert ist - warten, bis man es in einem Bundle oder im Sale abgreifen kann, lohnt sich aber natürlich genauso!
