32661080.review:
This game is not really a game. It's a kinetic novel (a.k.a., a visual novel with no choices or branching routes). It's all narrative with no voice acting, and all the reader needs to do is click spacebar to advance. However, this is still a very nice story. The characters are all likable and/or relatable in their own ways. While the story is pretty laid back for the most part with a number of cliches peppered here and there, it has its moments of tension. Seeing the relationship between Amber and Marina (the two main characters) develop help makes the story all the more lovely. There are two brief "adult" scenes (that are not included in the Steam version; you have to get the patch off the game's website) but they fortunately are not what High Blossoms builds to or revolves around.

If you're looking for a 4-6 hour game that is very relaxing, has good music, great art, and well written characters, go for this one. It's a very atypical kinetic novel, being set in the American midwest and having been made by Americans (meaning no translation errors). I wouldn't give this a numeric rating if I could on Steam. All I can say is that I definitely give this game a recommendation.

32574394.review:
Been wanting to play this a while, finished the game right on its 1 year anniversary, I guess its a thing worth celebrating?
(because this game is pretty damn good.)

This game probably takes 4~7 hours to finish, give or take, depending on your reading speed. Nonetheless it was quite a decent ride, and pretty much delivers what it promises.

First of all, top notch music and art for a VN. The backgrounds are well drawn, and captures the essence of the American deserts. It's refreshing to see different art styles though it may trigger some OCD people, but hey so far so good. The excellent usage of camera is appreciated, helps with the immersion and the emotions expressed by the characters. The soundtrack hits home completely, it symbolizes what a road trip is like on American deserts, and also ties into how the characters' emotions play out. Fucking amazing.

As for gameplay, since this is a kinetic VN, you pretty much just only need to let your eyes do the work. There are no choices for you to make, no consequences etc. This greatly benefitted the game, as the whole VN plays out just like a movie, which is just like any road trip if you'd ask me. After you finish the game, prepare yourself for another ride in Goofball Mode, albeit a shorter playthough, though bit more fun. 

The characters are nicely fleshed out, Amber's wittiness with Marina's general childish curiosity creates a nice contrast, making both heroines very memorable in their own way. Though the writers may have pushed the tomboyness of Amber a bit too much to my liking. The supporting cast of characters are interesting in their own right. The treasure hunting trio made up of the hothead Mariah, the levelheaded Joe and the silent yet ever observative Tess. Their gearhead antics differs them a lot from other supporting characters in VNs, which makes me hope a sequel of sorts will be focused on them instead. They are appropriately used without being presented as overly annoying rivals, and gives Amber some valuable advice. There is one character named Cassi that only had 1 scene, which baffled me as to whether she was part of some cut content or an oversight on the devs' part.

[h1] Potential spoilers for plot [/h1]
The story just screams "America" to me, and it's definitely a welcomed theme, as most VNs tend to be set in Japan, and its really nice that this game took the different approach. The plot is divided into 3 parts, the treasure hunt, the road trip and AmberxMarina. There is also a ton of foreshadowing in the story, yet it doesn't affect the main plot at all.

The treasure hunt probably had a bit more scenes that are hard to get excited, like Canyon de Chelly, though once you get past that, you'll be treated to a fun adventure. The miner's journal is optional, though you may find it an amusing short read. A nice thing to have. 

The road trip is like getting a taste of the different locations our heroines visit. One can kind of learn a bit of the history of the locations, and maybe a few things to pay attention to when on a road trip in these locations. I'm tempted to visit these places one day.

Onto the main course, the AmberxMarina relationship. Come on, who doesn't like Yuri? Jokes aside, this part has been given the most development, with the seeds planted already in the treasure hunt plot, allowing the relationship to develop at a believable pace. They both make up for what each other lacks, it may seem mismatched to some, but at least its not some tsundere crap we're getting from Animu these days. Familial bonds is a strong factor to both girls' motivations, allowing them to exchange interesting casual conversations that help define their character and uniqueness. The joy and struggles both girls face is so genuine that its heart-warming and heart-wrenching respectively.

The treasure hunt plot does feel a bit too lucky, however, given that its not the main focus, I guess a happy ending for a treasure hunt is acceptable. Despite this, if I were to be very nitpicky, the plot doesn't really feel all that special compared to other aspects of the game, which somewhat helped grounded the game in realism, as it does sort of depict the struggles in any ordinary relationship.

Now onto the side stuff, achievements are fairly easy to get in this game, bit of a fun nod from the devs on the lenny achievement. The adult patch is optional, I played with it, and found it not too distracting from the main story. Just short and steamy. Love it. It would be nice, if the soundtrack can be accessed in-game, but hey, its amazing regardless. Occasional typos here and there, but no game is perfect, and it didn't really hinder my experience at all. It also seems I may have gotten lucky, or perhaps its due to me completing the game in one sitting, no technical issues for me. As to the lack of voice acting, I don't really mind, in fact I rather it not ever appearing in this game. Letting the soundtrack do its thing, and having the characters convey their emotions through it is far more immersive and relaxing.

Bit of a lengthy review, but I felt like I had to write what's on my mind and here we are. Definitely would recommend this to people interested in yuri.

32524311.review:
Highway Blossoms is the story of 2 young women who meet by chance. One had her car break down on the side of the road and the other decides to help her. After various things happen, they decide to go on a treasure hunt together to look for gold that was buried in the Southwest United States. This starts a very sweet and fun adventure where they meet some other crazy characters along the way.

This is a kinetic visual novel, so there are no choices or gameplay whatsoever. It's essentially just a novel but with graphics and music. The graphics are beautiful and the music fits perfectly, without seeming too repetitive nor getting old. The plot itself is ultimately a love story, but the road trip/treasure hunting adventure throws in plenty of other things along the way. The love story is between two women, but it is very tastefully done. This is not one of those sorts of stories that is aimed specifically for a heterosexual male audience, like can happen sometimes. I think anyone could enjoy it, regardless of gender identity or sexual orientation.

I highly recommend anyone who loves visual novels to give this a read. I don't think you'll regret it!

This is a super awesome VN thingy. I really liked the art when I first saw it, and a yuri visual novel is right up my alley, but I got a bit nervous when I saw most of the production team were men. I expected it to be fetishy and gross, but I couldn't have been more wrong. This ended up being the most touching and honest lesbian love story I've seen in any piece of media. Even the (optional) sex scenes feel natural and in character, rather than something made just to see boobs. The art is beautiful, the music is so atmospheric and perfect and the characters are so loveable and realistic. By the end of the story, I was crying for an hour straight and ready to take someone special to see all the sights Amber and Marina visited. 32445367.review:
HERE THERE BE MINOR SPOILERS. More serious story spoilers are actually spoilered.

------------------------

Still here? Okay.

I think it's important to understand right up front that this is not a game or a dating simulator in even the slightest way. This is a comic book, a manga perhaps? The most interaction you have with the story is turning the page and selecting or de-selecting the silly modes. You are never a player who can take actions and make choices; you are a reader.

But for those who do like good literature, well... the protagonist is a blatant a male-viewer-insert--she's pretty much just a re-brand of a similar male archetype, down to the masculine speech/internal monologuing patterns, and she and the other focused female characters (thankfully not the child) are obviously drawn as eye candy. The latter is particularly pervasive to invasive, as boobs are shoved in your face for almost the entire story, and it somewhat taints the work.

Borrowing heavily from extremely cliche anime archetypes and stereotypes really doesn't do the characters any favours either. Neither does the part where [spoiler]the developers poke fun at themselves, and to some degree the expected audience, by having a street artist paint the boobs as being even bigger[/spoiler], to be honest.

And there's a distinct lack of tension whenever the story turns back to the "gold rush" plot line because [spoiler]the protagonist wins almost every time, usually without a lot of effort. The only time she doesn't, it's not because of the only clear antagonist, whom she beats every time--it's just bad luck. The happy ending is [i]nice[/i], [/spoiler]and the way character development and action are tied together at the climax is well-enough done, but the "gold rush" plot line is simply not satisfying--[spoiler]it's quite heavily sold, but then becomes unimportant, and the protagonist's victory there grows to feel inevitable pretty early.[/spoiler]

I have mixed feelings because there are some positives. The humour seems to be where it's needed, in particular, the action is pretty good, I did mention the climax is pretty good, and the scene with [spoiler]just the protagonist and Mariah in the luxury RV[/spoiler] is oddly gratifying.

I'm still waiting for Steam to implement some kind of middle rating between "recommend" and "do not." In the meantime, I would say not to buy this at full price. It's better than the trash novels one of my grandmothers hoarded, and I was entertained somewhat, but neither are worth the $10 you could order or download a [i]good[/i] book for.

-------

I don't recommend the adult content patch at all, incidentally; the skin and chests already being placed right above the words at all times was distracting enough when they weren't sometimes uncovered. The developers themselves say the patch adds nothing to the plot, and in my experience it distracts, thus detracts, from everything meaningful that surrounds the adult content and what the adult content causes. And I have trouble putting a finger on why, but the writing of them irritated me. Perhaps it's just an inconsistency between the style of them and the style of the rest of the story; I'm not re-reading to find out.

Also, some of the added or changed images look like your average internet "nude edits", i.e. someone painted over a clothed character and made them look a little proportionally [i]weird[/i] in the process--or did they just forget important facts, such as that boobs don't normally scrunch together without something holding them that way? The style and ability expressed in the ones that don't look like nude edits don't really stand out from what you can find anywhere on the internet for free, and I think this is in part due to the choice of a pretty generic character style for the whole story to begin with.

I guess if you need that kind of fun, but you also require some degree of story or emotional investment, and you don't mind that the protagonist is basically a male character with a female sprite tacked on... I'm not sure why you would pay $10 for the experience, though.

Please understand that I am not saying all of this to be a prude; there is nothing wrong with sex (sometimes graphic, if necessary) in a story. I am simply evaluating the story and the patch based on what the story claims to be and tries to do.

32394072.review:
Sarò sincero, di solito evito le "kinetic novel" (ovvero quelle visual novel dove si "legge e basta", senza scelte da parte del giocatore). Mi piace leggere, e notoriamente nei libri l'unica "scelta" possibile si riduce a "ho finito la pagina, la giro per andare alla prossima" o "ho troppo sonno, meglio continuare domani" X-D, ma in contesto videoludico preferisco le visual novel "classiche", che ti permettono di plasmare la storia sulla base delle scelte effettuate. Se poi vedo che le suddette kinetic novel hanno qui su Steam i tag "Nudità" e/o "Sexual Content", le probabilità che le eviti aumentano notevolmente - sarò prevenuto, ma nelle visual novel notoriamente "sesso e tette" mal si sposano con il concetto di "buona storia da leggere", dato che generalmente la storia diventa solo un pretesto per inserire il suddetto "sesso e tette" qua e là.

Fortunatamente, però, ci sono delle eccezioni: a volte sono determinate da "meriti artistici", come Nekopara, mentre a volte per meriti narrativi, come questo gioco, Highway Blossoms - gioco che mi ha stupito e entusiasmato come non mi capitava da un bel pezzo a questa parte con una visual novel.
La storia di base è quasi "banale": una ragazza, Amber, alla guida del suo camper in mezzo al deserto, dà un passaggio ad una ragazza che è rimasta ferma con la propria auto, Marina. Come Amber presto scoprirà, Marina si è messa, come tante altre persone, alla ricerca di un tesoro, diviso in più parti, sepolto in alcuni luoghi dei quali si conoscono soltanto alcuni vaghi indizi. Nonostante la riluttanza iniziale, e le differenze caratteriali (Amber è una ragazza di mondo, dal carattere deciso e con una vasta conoscenza pratica delle cose, mentre Marina ha la testa tra le nuvole, un carattere più dolce ed una vasta ignoranza del mondo), le due partono insieme alla ricerca di questa fantomatica fortuna nascosta chissà dove...
Al di là della storia in sè, che può piacere o non piacere, o dello stile artistico, che personalmente trovo molto piacevole, la cosa secondo me bella, ma veramente bella, di questa visual novel è la narrazione - detto in poche parole, è scritta benissimo. Ha uno stile narrativo semplice, quasi essenziale, eppure tocca sempre i tasti giusti, riesce a rendere emozionante la storia e a farti vivere le sensazioni e le emozioni dei personaggi come se le stessi provando sulla tua stessa pelle. E i vari protagonisti, in particolar modo ovviamente Amber e Marina, sono caratterizzati divinamente - non ci vuole infatti molto per trovarsi a "pensare come loro", e i dialoghi che li coinvolgono sono veramente un piacere da leggere. Pure le scene di sesso sono pochissime e funzionali alla storia, cosa che mi ha piacevolmente sorpreso e ha sfatato quel brutto "mito" di cui vi parlavo nell'introduzione a questa recensione.
Un applauso (virtuale) quindi agli AlienWorks, gli sviluppatori di questo gioco, e un deciso pollice in su di votazione - una valutazione ampiamente meritata.

P.S.: immaginando che il 70% dell'utenza media che sfoglia questa pagina lo faccia perché ha visto il tag "Nudità", o quello "Sexual Content" X-D, vi dico subito che (1) questo gioco è "yuri", ovvero donna x donna (fate voi quindi le dovute considerazioni su cosa ciò significhi) e (2) la versione su Steam è quella "All Age" - ergo, nessun contenuto per adulti. Se volete aggiungere tale contenuto, vi basterà andare sul sito ufficiale e scaricare GRATUITAMENTE una sorta di patch - non andate quindi a cercarla chissà dove, c'è direttamente sul sito ufficiale. Tra parentesi tale patch è NECESSARIA se volete avere il 100% degli achievement.

P.P.S.: questo gioco ha, cosa quasi unica per una kinetic, una sorta di New Game+ - una volta finito il gioco, infatti, è possibile attivare una modalità che cambia alcune piccole parti della storia e aggiunge degli "effetti"... rimango volutamente sul vago, ma vi dico subito che dev'essere il risultato di una sbornia particolarmente potente da parte degli autori. X-D Idem per la sorta di "storia alternativa" presente, anch'essa sbloccabile dopo aver finito il gioco almeno una volta. X-D

This was include in a Sekai Project Humble Bundle, and I never tried a visual novel before. I liked the idea of going on an American road trip, so I figured why not. Also, I played this instead of studying for finals and oh my, no regrets...

The music, the rich character development, and the hand-drawn landscapes of Southwestern United States, makes this a unique and memorable experience. In addition, I've learned so much from the historic landmarks and attractions in Highway Blossoms that I plan on going to visit them myself!

32372243.review:
[b]A friend gave me a steam key via the Humble Bundle sale of Sekai VN's. It has been on my wishlist for quite some time.[/b]

Where do I start...

This is an adventure romance story. If you're expecting hot steamy yuri sex to get off on... first off, get hit upside the head, TWICE, with the sunday papers rolled up, and instead I'll point you towards the Sakura series for that you sick freak. Don't forget your tissue and lotion... or if you're female, penetration toy. (As for any "other" genders, cleary this isn't for you as there are no trans people in the story, nor should there be. Triggered? Good. Moving on...)

I really enjoyed the story. It felt more American made than Asian made, which is a nice change. The writing lost me a few times, like when it was getting technical of landmark locations in the dessert states, but wanted to find a good spot to stop and come back later instead of in the middle.

The characters are very well fleshed out, didn't spot any flaws or issues with them. Character development felt spotty but it's there, don't worry, they do change gradually. The minor/supporting characters fit their role just fine and didn't feel over or under used. The major characters, however, were bit of a grind to get through; namely Amber and Marina. The development of these two could've been a bit faster in some parts, but was glad to see the pacing pick up later on.

The plot has two things going on: treasure and romance. The switch between the two is smooth and at appropriate times. When the treasure story was finished, it went full romance from there (which made it a bit boring for me but wasn't... I guess "Twilight" level of romance). It's nice to read a story that isn't based on mythology or magical powers or "I have big boobs, look at me as they bounce!" like most asian VN's do these days, but instead down to earth and based on realistic settings that anyone can relate to better.

The game offers no choice for the player as it is a one linear path from start to finish. There is also no voice acting.

My only problems to me was that some of the sliders in the settings (volumes, text speed) were gone but yet there. It's not really an inconvenience for me. Another was that just after I finished installing, my AV labled it as a trojan (which freaked me out instantly) but turns out some update they did awhile go is triggering a flase flag and would require to white list the .exe file.

It's really touching, gives you a few laughs here and there with the writing and visuals it gives to help lighten the mood. There will be times you want to go "Just kiss already!" but don't worry it'll get there at it's own pace

-----

32260516.review:
Soundtrack: 5/5 -- HB deserves its "great soundtrack" tag. The music is appropriate, enjoyable, and diverse. It's well-suited to the game and there are enough different tracks that it doesn't get boring.
Art: 5/5 -- Background art is gorgeous. Lots of CGs where other games would use sprites. Sprites are nice, too. I fell in love with the paintings of the West.
Programming: 4/5 -- In like, the third-ish chapter there were some issues where the text box would hide while sprites switched expressions. And Auto was sometimes difficult for me. Nitpicky issues, but didn't cause any big problems.
Story: 3.5/5 -- I love the plot: wanderer and hitch-hiker team up to find treasure and fall in love but they experience more than what either of them expected. I think I would've liked more Amber and Marina background. Plus when you think about the fact they fell in love over like three weeks it's a little strange that they get so into each other. I low-key agree with Mariah that these girls are fools. Most of the issue I take with the story was in the pacing, however, so it was forgivable.
Grillz: 5/5
Dank Memes: 5/5 -- Goofball Mode is super silly. I took like a million screenshots for my personal collection.

I've waited since this game came out for the excuse to purchase it. I was fortunate enough to pick it up in the Sekai Project Humble Bundle. I'm glad I picked it up in the bundle because I definitely would've paid the straight $10 for it. 

Overall, game feels like a 4/5. Worth picking up if you have interest in it.

31888370.review:
Pros
-Likeable characters.
-Decent, believable narrative with enough momentum/urgency.
-Artwork and music is good. Animated portions are simple but a nice touch.

Neutral
-Adult content adds little to nothing for plot (Do it for CG and achievement, I guess)
-Pure visual novel. No choices to make, no side routes, no dead ends.
-Around 7 hours reading time, depending on your reading speed.

Cons
-Needs a little bit of editing for grammar and spelling, though minor.
-A named character left unused.

Highway Blossoms offers a decent, queer narrative which follows two characters, Amber and Marina. They meet out of happenstance when Marina's car breaks down. Amber gives Marina a ride which evolves into a mad race for gold. The narrative is heartwarming but has its bumps along the way.

Character tropes are present giving a sense of how some characters respond, however, character development breaks some of the general conventions. The adult portions do not add to plot and could also do with a bit of editing. One named character remained unused.

30764175.review:
tl;dr Decent yuri kinetic novel, a story of grief, new love, forgiveness and healing; also, treasure hunting: 8/10. 

Overall, it's a good story. The characters are relatable and realistic, the scenario isn't overtly ridiculous, also it's at least a bit over the top. It does a very good job of making you actually care for Amber and Marina. 

I would highly recommend playing with the uncensor patch, since like any truely good VN (aka unlike most VNs), the sex scenes aren't there simply for fan service, but actually serve a as very important part of the character and plot development. 

It's relatively short; I finished it in probably about 5 hours of actual play time. It does have a 2nd mode, which allows for "goofball" scenes; I don't think I'll be playing it again just for those however. I felt it was a good length for the story it was telling. Unlike, for example, Grisaia no Kajitsu, I never felt that you were trying to slog through a bunch of dreck in order to get to the good stuff. Honestly, I find that far too many VNs seem to mistake length for quality, and end up padding the story with a bunch of stuff that just makes me despise it. This did not happen here. 

The art was good; you should be able to get a decent idea of what to expect based off just the screenshots available on Steam. The soundtrack helped set the mood nicely. 

I initially purchased this having missed the fact it is a kinetic novel rather than a full branching VN. Or Are KNs a subset of VNs? Anyways, in general I really do wish that the tags up top would emphasize that more, since the difference between choices and no choices is a pretty big deal IMHO. That having been said, it does make it pretty clear in the description, so that's my fault for missing it. 

Anyways, I'm rather pleased with the value I got for the purchase; bought during a valentine's day sale for 40% off. 

Also, if it matters at all, the cards this game drops sell for a weirdly high price; selling them ended up offsetting almost a quarter of the purchase price.

30042999.review:
My opinion of Highway Blossoms:

1. If you are into interesting background depictions (American Mid-West, treasure hunt around real geographic locations, desert music festival, on the road scenarios...), this is a BUY!

2. If you are into visual novels (beware: no game or interaction!) with good graphics (persons and backgrounds) and lots of different (and also good) music, this is a GOOD BUY!

3. If you are into stories with a bit of action telling behind it - where a treasure search against time and some adversaries  (also good depicted and with good story elements) actually leads to a gold finding...and a far grater love treasure in the course of action ;-) - this is a RECOMMENDED BUY!

4. If you are into romantic story telling of two young adults with some dramatic elements in it due to personal problems regarding familiy loss and commitment fears - this is a VERY RECOMMENDED BUY!

5. If you are into yuri / girl x girl stories where you can actually believe (due to good character and personality and action depictions) that both girls fell in love in the course of the story, this is an ABSOLUTE MUST BUY!

...because, simply put, there are many stories out there which are not believable at all (and even wishful thinking doesn't help).

6. There is some optional 18+ mature content as well (not within Steam, please read other postings below on how to activate it) which actually is no plot device but fits just fine into the story.

IMO the graphics are not so interesting (though they are worth watching ;-)) as is the story-telling during those scenes, again it depicts rather well the character and background story of both girls. For 18+, you CAN BUY!


Perhaps I should write a far longer review because I like Highway Blossoms very much, I truly recommend this novel.


IMO Very good work, Alienworks!


By the way: The girls' names are Amber and Marina... :-)

30012567.review:
I bought this game on a whim after stumbling upon it in the Steam Store a few days ago. It was on sale, and the reviews were pretty good, so I bought it. Not without some qualms: it was made by a studio I'd never heard about, and the setting seemed difficult to nail down in a kinetic novel like this one. I wasn't sure if I'd regret my decision or not.

Thankfully, Highway Blossoms is one of the most charming and entertaining visual/kinetic novel I've read in a long time. I don't regret buying it in the slightest.

I'm not going to bother giving a synopsis--lots of other people have done that already. Anyway, a synopsis wouldn't do the characters, scenarios, and events in this novel justice. It's brief, only officially 4-6 hours (I finished in three because I couldn't put it down), and it's clichéd and hamfisted in a few points, but these flaws don't distract from something with this much heart, tact, and beauty. Some of the art is impeccable, the soundtrack is brilliant at points (especially the credits song), and the characters never failed to make me laugh or gasp when that was their intent. I've always been a sucker for love stories--I guess it shows--but this is one story I'll be a sucker for for a long time coming. It makes me want to go out on an adventure of my own some day.

TL;DR: Give this game a try. Even if you don't LOVE it, you might get something out of it. I know I did.

29911563.review:
I was gifted this game by a friend of mine, and I don't think she knew, but it was incredibly appropriate as it was mere months since my dad passed away suddenly, leaving a hole in my life, and the lives of my immediate family. And he did seem to talk more - and more freely - while driving than any other time, and he did seem to often communicate through the weird obscure music he played in his car more than he did through words.

So... gifting this game to me was really appropriate. I think... unknowingly so.

And this game really helped, but... not so much in the form of "I know what Amber is going through", since - well, that's utterly no use to me other to know it doesn't lead to anything good - but in the form of "just plain helping out with stuff is one thing, but I really need to wake up and play the Marina role to try and bring my suffering, grieving family out of gloom". And you know... it kind of worked.

Thumbs up to this game for inspiration, even if I feel like it didn't intend to be.

But, more of a review for the actual game - it's alright! It's an odd little VN which is half treasure hunting, rivalry and tourism, and then half romance, grieving and angst. Though the first half does naturally flow into the other, and there is crossover, it definitely feels like it's split down the middle, and that the first half ended kind of abruptly. 

As you might have gathered, I thought the amount of detail to the characters was pretty good, though I might place more into the two main characters than other readers due to my personal connection. I also really appreciated the trio of rival characters, they were fun.

I quite enjoyed the tourism - I'm not from the US so other than the Grand Canyon and Las Vegas it's just "oh hey it's that place I've seen on TV. It has a name?!" So I ended up googling for images of the places they went to, and that was fun. I do feel like a game with such emphasis on actual places should have used more background images - detailed ones - to convey the majesty of the locations covered, because it was quite central to the game. That's not to say that there were hardly any, it is to say that it could have done with more since it was all about sharing the experience.

The rivalry, the romance, the treasure hunting, the grieving and angst... I also thought were good, though I think some parts near the end could have been handled a little better. I think I'd venture into major spoilers if I tried to explain.

Overall, though, it's good and I recommend this kinetic VN.

29258313.review:
Вообще это первая визуальная новелла в таком жанре, которую я прочитал, так что мне сравнивать не с чем(пока что)), поэтому будет краткий обзор достойнств и недостатков. Приступим.

История о двух девушках, которые по случайности встретились и полюбили друг друга, ищя вместе сокровища.

Достоинства:

[list]
[*] Сюжет и персонажи
Хотя история и коротка, но её интересно читать. Особенно было интересно читать журнал шахтера и наблюдать затем как девушки ищут сокровища.
Персонажи здесь стандартные(Не считая нетрадиционной ориентации у двух девушкек). Но всю историю меня не покидала мысль, что Эмбер должна быть парнем и разработчики что-то препутали). Например, в сюжет случались стандартные нелепые ситуации,которые обычно случаются между парнем и девушкой. А окружающие вели себя так будто у них лесбиянки это часто встречающееся явление. Конечно, я понимаю что тут жанр такой и это нужно чтобы проще построить историю.

[*] Графика и арты
Графика и арты на высоте.
Особенно мне преглянулся спрайты Эмбер, а вот насчет Мэрайи(или Марии, я так и не понял как правильно перевести Mariah), в её спрайте мне всё время мозолил глаза контур, как мне показалось, отличающийся от других.

Ну тут вообще не к чему придраться. Саундтреки подходят и для путешествия (в том числе и до магазина), и для обычного прослушивания.
[/list]

Недостатков, кроме как то, что история немного коротковата, я не нашел. Да и этот единственный недостаток очень незначительный. Не думаю, что  нужно писать большую историю между двумя девушками, если девушек, допустим, было бы пять на выбор, то ту уже нужно заморочиться над сюжетом. А то, что нам предлагает игра вполне достаточно. Тогда получается серьезных недостатков в новелле нет.

Да, обзор получился побольше чем я рассчитывал. Ну, да ладно.

29117349.review:
Highway Blossoms went above and beyond what I expected from a Visual Novel, I'm extremely glad I took the time to play this gem of a game. 

Story wise, the game is rather short. But that's mostly because I read pretty fast, so I clocked in around 4 hours or so of reading instead of the stated 6 hours or so stated. Guess all that fanfiction reading skills got put to good use lmao. 

One thing I liked about the writing in general was how trim it was. There's almost no filler throughout the entire story and I can appreciate a game that tells a simple, great story rather than just dragging on for no particular reason but to increase your playtime. The other thing I liked was the humor, which got quite alot of chuckles from me throughout. Also, I found the main couple Amber and Marina heart stoppingly cute, and their dialouge even more so. 

Art-wise, the game is flawless. CG's and backgrounds are superb on my monitor and the words in the text box are easy to read and easy on the eyes. Character sprites (is that the right word?) do occasionally move and I love how sutble and effective it was in trying to make everything more lifelike. Masterful programming. There is no bugs, as far as I can tell,  which makes it the icing on top of the cake. 

The music is pleasant throughout as well. I never once thought the background music was grating. On the contrary I found it rather relaxing to listen to, so I'll definitely be getting the DLC soundtrack. Highway Blossoms also makes good use of its music as well as silence. There are stretches of story that have no music at all - which makes the seriousness of the current scene pack a heavier punch. 

Overall, I think that Highway Blossoms is a quality VN. For it's length and quality of the content, the asking price is more than fair. I wouldn't hesitate to buy this if I was a yuri fan (viva la yuri) or a avid VN reader. 

TL:DR - 9/10

特地贡献一份中文评测，以督促大家买买买。

毫无疑问，HB是Steam里质量上乘的百合VN。

比较稳定而无明显画风崩坏的CG，恰到好处的配乐，[spoiler]情而不色的NSFW内容，[/spoiler]作为一款独立游戏，这样的素质可以说是过关了。主观上来说，HB优秀的文本让我对其的喜爱甚至超过某些日系百合VN，因为比起日系里一惊一乍的戏剧性人物，HB里疏松平常的互动所营造的真实感更戳我心。

关于故事背景，高票评测所述有误，并不是历史上的美国淘金热，虽说的确是淘金，但感觉时间是20世纪后期的样子。背景设置得挺大，但故事没有表现出波澜壮阔的感觉，而是注重于主角二人的关系。这样一个难能可贵的简单故事我是相当欢迎的。

另外，作者竟然还有心思给游戏写一本轻小说，dusty trails，讲述的是三人组的故事。发售时我大概会想办法搞一本来看看。
Even though I could manage to purchase the light novel dusty trails in China, I still hope it can be available on steam as a DLC of HB.

商店介绍是六七个小时的流程，不过英语毕竟不是母语，要多花一些时间，但也不超过10小时。

强烈建议通关后开简单难度的新游戏，别吐槽为啥VN有难度选择，有惊喜。

28696358.review:
[i]Highway Blossoms[/i] is told from the perspective of Amber, a young woman on a road trip in the Southwestern United States driving an old motor home. During an otherwise uneventful drive through a desert in New Mexico, she comes across Marina whose car has just ran out of gas leaving her stranded. She picks her up and heads off to the nearest gas station. It is there that Amber learns about the second gold rush in the region. An old miner's journal has recently been discovered and published detailing instructions on where to find several hidden stashes of gold. Mostly by Marina's prodding, the duo head out on an adventure throughout the Southwest to find this treasure, though they are not the only ones looking for it.

This game is a kinetic novel, a type of visual novel where there are no branching storylines and only one ending. It can be played as fast as the player can read it. I would estimate that it would take the average reader around 6-8 hours to read it from beginning to end.

I thought the story was pretty good overall. It was enjoyable to read and humorous at times while also developing the relationship between the main characters at a good pace. Although the story was certainly enjoyable, I did feel it was more on the predictable side. There are no real plot twists and the ending is not exactly surprising. Still, as a feel-good story, it does the job well.

The characters were a bright spot as well. The two main characters, Amber and Marina, come off as cute and likable and I enjoyed seeing their relationship unfold. They are somewhat clichéd, though, with Amber being the tomboy and Marina being the more girly girl.

Two other aspects of this game deserve special mention. The first would be the art. The setting of the game, the Southwestern United States, is a bit unconventional for visual novels. I thought [i]Highway Blossoms[/i] did an excellent job of utilizing its setting. The background artwork was fantastic all around as it brought to life the desert environment. The sprites of the characters were well drawn, distinctive, and colorful. The only critique I have is that the CGs were a bit inconsistent with the rest of the artwork.

The other outstanding aspect of this game would be the music. A lot of it really reminded me of music that you might hear in a western film befitting the game's setting well. I sometimes found myself pausing at moments during play just to listen to the music a little. It really enhanced the experience of reading this.

Overall, despite a somewhat predictable plot, this is an enjoyable visual novel that includes great artwork, excellent music, and likable characters. If you like visual novels with a romance theme, you are likely to enjoy this.

28519575.review:
Malgré le pouce bleu, je n'ai pas aimé particulièrement ce jeu, ni ne peut sincèrement le détester ; pour faire court, il ne m'a simplement pas "pris". Ce qui suis, c'est pour ceux qui veulent le détail de mon ressenti sur Highway Blossom.

J'aime bien les visual novels, j'en ai fait un assez bon nombre, je pense, pour me considérer comme un amateur. Pour moi, ce qui fait que j'accroche ou pas à un jeu de ce genre (dont le gameplay se limite à lire du texte et, parfois, faire des choix pour les protagonistes), c'est le scénario, pour résumer. Après tout, c'est l'essence du genre ! Si l'histoire est bonne, j'accroche. Si les personnages sont intéressants ou intrigants, je m'y intéresse. Si l'action qui est racontée est captivante, je m'y immerge sans retenue.

Rien de tout ça ne s'est produit avec ce jeu, durant les presque 2h que j'y ai joué. Bien que visuellement agréable, cette nouvelle ne m'a pas pris, n'a pas titillé ma curiosité. Les 2 personnages principaux, assez clichés quoique ça ne me gène pas en soi, ne m'ont pas donné envie de connaitre leur histoire, que l'on devine d'ailleurs rapidement. Le contexte de l'histoire, comme son déroulement, ne m'ont fait ni chaud ni froid. En bref, j'ai été assez indifférent à tout ce qui fait le coeur d'un visual novel à mon sens, avec ce jeu.
Bien sûr, je n'ai joué qu'aux 2 premières heures de l'histoire, histoire qui demande 8h de lecture d'après ce que j'ai lu ; mais le fait est que j'ai rarement lu un démarrage aussi mou, aussi plat. Même le début de If My Heart Had Wings me semble plus captivant en comparaison, et pourtant c'est un des VN les plus denses que j'ai fait.
Du coup, j'ai vite décroché, et j'ai fini par speedrunner le jeu pour avoir les achievements et pouvoir le désinstaller.

Ce qui ne veut pas dire que HB est nécessairement mauvais ; c'est plus probablement moi qui suis devenu plus exigeant avec ce genre vidéoludique ; faut dire qu'après Grisaia No Kajitsu et Danganronpa, la barre est haute niveau scénario.
En soi, je pense même que ce jeu peut tout à fait plaire à certains lecteurs, ceux qui aiment les histoires de road-trip à l'américaine, les aventures de chasse au trésor, et éventuellement les romances fille/fille (faut DL le patch pour les 2 scènes, mais honnêtement, je pense qu'on peut trouver mieux ailleurs pour ce seul point).

Du coup, pourquoi le pouce bleu ? Bah parce que même si je n'ai pas aimé ce jeu, j'attends de voir ce que va donner la prochaine sortie de ce petit studio, que je n'ai pas le coeur de défoncer allègrement. J'veux dire, les CG sont jolis, les musiques se laissent écouter même si la country n'est pas mon style favori, et pour 10 balles, j'estime ne pas voir été volé, loin de là. Bref, je veux saluer l'intention et la bonne volonté, même si j'y ai été assez insensible. 

A charge de revanche, comme on dit :P

28253324.review:
A good yuri game, worth the price tag and the time.

It has it flaws and plotholes, but it doesn't really dampens the whole storyline as a whole. You will find several scene that either happens without any prior notice, or a scene that does not lead to anything. There's a whole lot of nitpicking to be done, but if you do no do nitpicking, you'll enjoy the whole story.

The settings itself is pretty unique as well, since you're a girl with a past, meeting a girl with trouble, and sets out on prospecting journey. Pretty original and creative, even if the characters is a collection of cliches, but it's not as blatant as several VN.

The design for the characters is pretty fun and charming, and you have Tess, which is the most adorable thing you can get. Sadly, there's no variety on the design, since all of the characters wears the exact same clothes throughout the game, save for sleeping. It might have something to do with the fact that they're living in a motorhome, but yeah, it feels cheap. There's also several inconsistency between the sprites and the CG, but it's not glaring to catch your eyes.

The environment and the music is pretty nice as well, giving you those wild west kind of feel, and i have no complain about it.

There's several hints about different route, but in the end there's only one route, and it does feels a bit lacking. With the price tag though, i can't complain much.

4/5, will pay more to romance Mariah

26506765.review:
Итак, оценка визуальной новеллы такова: она хорошая, 249 рублей безусловно стоит, нужно брать и читать.

Ну а теперь стена текста для таких же, как я, зануд.
Highway Blossoms стала второй моей визуальной новеллой и, что уж там говорить, при просмотре стимовского магазина привлекла исключительно своей не-японской тематикой. Серьёзно, нынче в стиме такого контента днём с огнём не сыщешь, а тут внезапно среди тонн однообразных японских сисек нарисовалась вроде как перспективная "роуд стори". И я часов этак на шесть с головою в неё погрузился.

Что ж, теперь по сути:
Это история о дорожных приключениях двух девушек, волею случайности (ну или судьбы, кому как больше понравится) нашедших друг друга на обочине. Одна на обочине своей жизни, другая... просто на обочине. Вот буквально.
Сюжет на первый взгляд кажется незамысловатым, а на второй взгляд таким и оказывается, но в этом, пожалуй и есть основной шарм: сценарист (или сценаристы?) умудрился растворить приключения в повседневности ровно в такой пропорции, чтобы полностью раскрыть главных героев и при этом не дать заскучать от однообразия. Локации постоянно сменяют одна другую, поддерживая темп, при этом повествование протекает от одной точки к другой плавно, а сама история плавно же сходит с приключенческих рельс к лёгкой драме, рассказу о человеческих чувствах. Разных чувствах. И это, чёрт возьми, хорошая сценарная работа. Сценарист чётко знал когда, что и в каком количестве он хотел сказать; когда добавить дерзкого экшена, когда добавить непринуждённой повседневности, когда добавить волнующей драмы. Писательские таланты, конечно, выдающимися я бы не назвал, в частности, иной раз очень не хватает описаний, но с этим вполне можно смириться.

Художественное оформление на неплохом уровне, в частности спрайты хорошие, миленькие и "вообще", как говорится. А вот фоны местами выглядят как-то уж совсем бедновато, да и хотелось бы их кое-где побольше. Есть пара сцен, где в силу скудного количества фонов и отсутствия хотя бы краткого описания местности вообще непонятно, что именно и как именно сейчас происходит. Редко и некритично, но чутка огорчило, что тут местами сэкономили на усилиях. Так или иначе, это всё равно очень неплохой уровень художественного оформления. Отдельно ещё пройдусь по дизайну персонажей - это однозначное попадание в "десятку". Полнейшее соответствие характерам.

Музыка как бы есть, но она как бы совсем уж фоновая и временами присутствует, такое впечатление, только для того, чтобы уши уж не слишком унывали. Серьёзно, есть музыка атмосферная, дополняющая картину повествования. Есть музыка для фона, просто играющая в тон динамике событий. Вот здесь второй вариант, и это немного печально. Общую картину не портит, впрочем.

Ну и конечно о патче 18+, куда ж без него. Что тут говорить, очевидно, к чему всё в конечном счёте должно прийти, да и сама вывеска в стиме намекает, что это юри история. Но, к счастью, эта визуальная новелла не следует принципу "юри ради юри", за что ей огромное спасибо. Соответствующие сцены являются частью истории, но история не построена вокруг них или ради них. Более того, скажу, что отношения между девушками выстроены последовательно и демонстрируют многие краеугольные камни, с которыми, увы, вполне можно столкнуться. Так или иначе, в этом плане здесь всё отлично.

Подводя итог.
Хотя, какой итог? Первыми строками уже всё было написано. Хорошая новелла. Покупайте, проводите время с уютом за чтением, переживайте вместе с героинями, немного грустите, что история закончилась (кстати, заканчивается она где-то за 6 часов неспешного чтения. И русификатор есть). В общем, однозначная рекомендация.

25996619.review:
Мне визуальная новелла в целом понравилась. Приятная атмосфера, душевная музыка, харизматичные персонажи(особенно кавайная Марина и сильная духом Эмбер). По сути Highway Blossoms мне напомнило эпоху Дикого запада с центральной темой Золотой лихорадки, только вместо лошади нашим главным героиням достался трейлер на котором они продвигаются по всем дорогам Соединённых Штатов Америки :) К тому что так может не радовать как Юри, особенно меня. То как я следил за развитием отношений между Эмбер и Мариной, было для меня самым запоминающимся моментом. Знакомстов на дороге, забавные и грустные моменты, некоторые из них были настолько тяжёлыми, что я боялся что история обернётся драмой где обычно герои расстаются и начинают идти в одиночестве по собственному пути. На благодаря старанию одного человека, Эмбер смогла смириться с тем что у неё есть и с трудом оставить прошлое позади ради свой возлюбленной Марины. Одним словом Highway Blossoms мне очень понравилась, особенно наличием развивающейся юри-романтики, а также лёгкой тематикой вестерна XXI века. Рекомендую сыграть в сию визуальную новеллу всем юри-отаку, а также фанатам современного Дикого запада. 
P.S. В честь данного произведения я взял на себя полную ответственность написать статью на Википедии.
https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Highway_Blossoms

25915755.review:
This is the first time I'm doing a review on Steam but I feel the game deserves it after this emotional rollercoaster ride.

Let me start off by saying that I am generally not a big fan of VN's. Most of them don't manage to keep my attention for long enough, be it due to bad writing, boring characters or scenes that drag on for too long.

Highway Blossoms however get's everything right. The dialogues are well written and at times witty. The characters are interesting, likeable and relatable and the development they go through, especially Amber, will keep you interested from start to finish.

The overall story offers a sense of adventure, comedy, action, drama and romance.

The artstyle for both the scenery as well as the characters is unique and gorgeous.

One of the things that stand out the most for a VN like Highway Blossoms is the Soundtrack. It's something worth listening to outside of the game, but it also makes the game shine. It makes you appreciate the story even more and gets you so much more involved in the context of the story.

For both VN lovers as well as those that have never played an VN before or even those that so far weren't impressed by regular VN's I'd highly suggest giving this game a try. I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

25775321.review:
Highway Blossoms is a beautiful and well written (adventure) story about two 'lost' individuals who, through a common goal, are able to find themselves again, and find a starting point to build a new life together.

What starts off as a modern take on the whole 1800s gold rush hype, soon evolves into a (gorgeous and emotional) romantic tale with coming-of-age elements mixed into it. 

Although the game certainly has some emotionally heavy moments, it's mostly a lighthearted story. Pacing and writing is strong enough that by the time the second half of the story starts, you really come to care for the main characters and the issues that they are facing.

Furthermore, Highway Blossoms features beautiful artwork and nice music.

Overall, this high quality VN is certainly worth your time and money!

25524806.review:
Highway Blossoms c'est un roadtrip dans l'ouest américain qui offre 8-10h de lecture pour le prix d'une place de cinéma. Suivez le voyage d'Amber durant une chasse au trésor prétexte à une série de clichés et rebondissements prévisibles dans une visual novel aussi agréable à lire qu'à regarder. C'est drôle, les différents thèmes sont abordés avec légèreté et les personnages sont presque tous intéressants.

Vous aimez:
- Les romances 
- Les directions artistiques correctes offrant quelques scènes plutôt jolies
- Les bandes sons parfaitement dans le ton et pas intrusives
- ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) 
- l'humour
- le drama

Vous n'aimez pas:
- Payer vos visual novel 30 euros pour avoir du voice acting
- Devoir faire des choix durant votre lecture
- Les scénarios compliqués
- Jumbo
- Les histoires tristes
- Les histoires qui trainent en longueur avec beaucoup de vent entre les chapitres

Recommandé pour les amateurs de bonne humeur comme moi.

25510524.review:
这是关于这个游戏的评测，但同时也是我自己在这个多少感到孤单清冷（或许也因为开着空调）的中秋节之夜的遐想和漫谈——它（不可避免的，与任何文本一样）是我心理浓缩、压抑或者移情的结果，当然，之所以选择这个游戏是有理由的。

首先要感谢@st同志的礼物。

美国中西部、公路旅行与小镇、十九世纪式淘金热的余晖、两个女孩和她们的房车、大裂谷、拉斯维加斯与加利福尼亚。

这些要素组合在一起，会让你想起一部什么样的故事？

是稍微反传统的，带着女性主义倾向的传统好莱坞西部叙事？牛仔、左轮枪、小镇正午的烈日、惩恶扬善的对决、夺宝奇兵一样的爽快故事？

是杰克伦敦笔下的淘金客故事，加拿大育空流域血与泪与怒吼的回响，人与大自然的搏斗，人性在逆境下最后的光辉，《热爱生命》、《野心的呼唤》、《白芳》、《北方的奥德赛》？

还是带着点叛逆和疯狂意味，充斥着对社会现实嘲弄和反抗的、不拘一格的狂放公路故事，就好像《末日狂花》和《邦尼和克莱德》？

好吧，都不是，这些沉重复杂的意义都是我擅自赋予的。Highway Blossoms（大概可以译为“公路百合”或者“高速之花”）实是个与所有的宏大冒险、花哨叙事、社会批判都无涉的温馨短剧。Amber和Marina两个年轻女孩的百合物语。从剧情量上看大概只相当于一个短中篇的视觉小说。

它最大的亮点在于清新细腻的作画、质量较高的CG和绝赞好评的原声带，在叙事方面没什么大的野心，而只是讲了个有关于亲情和爱情的纯粹小故事，说实话还挺青涩的···

但是至少我个人欢迎这种青涩和笨拙。身为二十一世纪生活的现代人，我们的人生里已经被各式娱乐产品灌饱了各种各样的恋爱故事，有些喜剧有些悲剧，有些王道有些俗套，有些无病呻吟有些精彩纷呈，有些足以拯救世界其他的也够确保点小确幸。然而——然而现实生活中与之匹配的经验的几率实在是过于渺茫。这时候就需要些纯粹、和煦、温暖而明亮的小故事了。

伴随着这个游戏一起在这种晚上涌上心头的，是《德州巴黎》，虽然有些电波，但《德州巴黎》真的太刻骨铭心了（忍不住要说）。

当然，其实制作用心的，以百合为唯一主题的小故事在市面上也不算多，对此感兴趣的话还是相对推荐的，英文六级以上的话看懂肯定没问题。

说到百合、孤独、美国中西部和一点点温暖，在此推荐一首很适合晚上慢慢循环的歌。并祝各位中秋快乐（藏在这种地方有谁看得到啊）。

City Hall，个人大爱的美籍华裔歌手史逸欣演唱，是她在美国纽约通过同性婚姻法案时所创作的纪念歌曲，真正意义上的百合歌哦（笑），在所有，所有意义上都跟这个游戏很般配。

25443286.review:
I was immediately drawn to Highway Blossoms just by the fact that it was yuri. Lesbians trekking the southwest for treasure in an RV??? Yes please. But what I got was so much more than that. A cute, heartwarming story about overcoming the troubles of your past and finally taking a step forward to take your own happiness into account. The music is amazing, albeit the large pauses in between tracks - the art is absolutely adorable, and far higher quality than most visual novels on Steam - the story is bland at some points, though it's overall extremely interesting, and I was rarely bored - and, unlike most yuri visual novels that exist, the plot isn't based thoroughly on sex. Hell, you don't even get the scenes unless you patch the game, and it still seems like you aren't missing anything. Overall, I'd rate Highway Blossoms a 9.8/10. 
I'm not one to give serious reviews, but, man, this game's worth it. 
Gay girls 4 days.

25260640.review: Oh, boy, how do I summarize this game. I bought it because hey, what the hell, it's basically The Crew/Oregon Trail/whatever as a VN. Then I actually got around to playing it. I finished it in a couple of days, then Goofball and EZ Modes were unlocked. I'm not gonna spoil 'em too much, but wow. If you laughed at the dialogue, then stay away from those. Especially EZ Mode which is just... wow. Also, the soundtrack is amazing so there's that.

25158652.review:
I love these developers. No seriously I want to sit down and have a drink with these people, because if they are even half as much fun in real life as in this game it’s going to be a blast.

Highway Blossoms is a very enjoyable yuri kinetic novel about two girls meeting in the desert and going to search for treasure. The story is very simple but well written, with a decent pace and a great sense of humour. The treasure hunt itself is more of a plot device than the main focus, which might be disappointing to anyone who was expecting more of an in-depth gold-rush adventure, but honestly the story is charming enough that it wasn't a concern for me. Alot of that came from the relationship between our two main characters. Amber is a very likeable protagonist even at her worst moments (and those breakfast puns she pulls out would make Sans very proud) while Marina is a very sweet yet kinda ditzy girl, her optimism never fails to make me smile although she did make me face-palm a few times. Their relationship feels natural and frankly adorable, but doesn’t forget that these are people with flaws that can get in the way of running smoothly. Our secondary leads, the trio of Mariah, Joe and Tess are also a lot of fun and very quirky. I must admit my favourite character overall is probably Mariah, which is weird because I’m not usually a fan of jerk characters but there was something really endearing about her so props to the writers for that. I also like how Highway Blossoms doesn’t explain everything but hints enough to get the imagination rolling, like the Trio’s backstory or even more about the miners journal itself. Heck after finishing the game I still think there’s something more to why Marina came out in the desert on her own but we get no more explanation than what she says, which is infuriating yet riveting at the same time. 

The artwork was gorgeous, each character design stood out and matched the personalities brilliantly. And the editing even got a bit hectic at times, it really added to the intense moments of the story, while the range of expressions were delightful to see (my particular favourite was Amber’s snarky face whenever she made a joke or took a jab at someone). Music is another strong point here and it’s one of those soundtracks I could easily listen to on its own, lots of guitars and that steady, easy driving atmosphere. It’s the kind of music I grew up listening to, mostly from my Dad, which actually means for me personally I could really connect to Amber’s loss of her Grandad and how much that music plays a part of her life, but even if you don’t have that connection I can still highly recommend this soundtrack.

The writing, artwork and music were enough to make me enjoy the game, but let’s get onto the bit that really made me fall in love with it: the extras! You’ve probably noticed there’s 17 achievements, but you only get 10 of them for going through the story. The rest is all for glorious extras! Took me a while to get the very last one as it takes a bit of fiddling ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°), but it didn’t feel like a boring hassle to do so. There’s the usual stuff, CG gallery, credits etc, and there’s also a gallery of guest art which is gorgeous, I’m definitely checking out these artists once I’ve posted this review. But then there’s the extra modes. You have goofball mode, which is worth going through the whole game again (on skip seen text) just to see these rather marvellous self-aware new dialogue, random text popups, and memes! Oh god this team has such a great sense of humour! The other mode is ‘EZ Mode’, which threw me off when I saw the option come up because this game is kinetic. There are no choices to make so why make it easier? But I played it and… if you compare an episode of ‘Yu Gi Oh!’ to an episode of ‘Yu Gi Oh! Abridged’ then you should get a good idea what EZ Mode is like compared to how the game is normally. 

Well that’s all I have to ramble about, overall this is a cute Yuri game with a fun story, enjoyable characters, and that extra special touch that just makes it a great experience. Highway Blossoms is one I can recommend to pretty much anyone who likes fun stories and good characters. Thank you so much AlienWorks for such a wonderful kinetic novel, I do look forward to seeing what else you come out with.

24722122.review:
Небольшая новелла о том, как, с первого взгляда абсурдные поиски золота могут обернуться находкой чего-то более серьёзного, например, подружки и вы тоже девушка, в общем. (золото вы всё таки найдёте)

Сама история для игрока задаёт несколько важных жизненных вопросов, почему одни люди сдаются, а другие идут до конца, насколько важна поддержка и как детство влияет на тебя в будущем, и парочку других, впрочем, это не так сильно напрягает на самом деле

Теперь о самой игре: 
- история сама по себе очень занимательная, она не надоедает, эта одна из тех историй, которую ты хочешь читать до конца, все персонажи, даже второстепенные, раскрыты полностью и у героев есть мотивы делать то, что они делают (кроме главной героини, ей просто скучно всё время ехать на трейлере по пустыне и думать о высоком)
- Графическая составляющая хороша, персонажи отрисованы хорошо, пейзажи трепещут своей красотой.
- За игру было обнаружено 0 багов и 0 вылетов на 8.1 (Windows 8.1) 
- Если вы хотите сделать игру совсем немного интересней, то разработчики выпустили для этого отдельный патч, который Steam, если бы он был добавлен в оригинальную версию, не одобрил бы, т.к он не хочет быть распространителем "сильно" эротического контента, но не мне его судить

В целом игрушка годная, если вы решили сначала почитать отзывы, а потом подумать над покупкой, то я смело могу вам заявить, что, скорее всего, возможно, вы не пожалеете об этом. Если у вас плохи дела с английским, то советую словарик взять, как я и сам делал.
 
А для тех, кто наплевал на мой душевный образ сверху, сухая оценка по 10-бальной шкале. 
9.0/10. Игра хорошая, интерестная и просто замечательная. [spoiler]У обоих 3-4 размеры, Карл, просто 3-4 размеры	[/spoiler]

24680957.review:
Cute visual novel about two girls on an RV road trip through the SW deserts of america looking for treasure. It's really gay. 

No dialogue choices or other gameplay. Make sure you get the adult patch. The sex scenes are a big payoff for the believable romance and tension that gets built up.

Had me believing in love for like 7.5 hours.

Also there's a sily version of the story with lots of memes sprinkled into the story. You unlock it by finishing the story. If you just want memes, I guess you could hit the skip button for a few minutes and then start a new game.

24680258.review:
Just sat down and finished this VN in one sitting.
I don't regret that one bit.

[i]I said "somewhere" in USA because I'm not sure where the starting point is and I don't want spoil exactly where they go.
I think the VN starts off somewhere around Arizona.
Feel free to correct me.[/i] 
_______________________________________________________


Story: The story is pretty simple, you start out with your everyday tomboyish girl whom goes by the name Amber driving down the highway in the middle of the desert somewhere in USA in her RV, until she spots a girl waving by the roadside.
The girl, whose name is Marina, being your every day cutie, the type of character that, whatever they do, it's cute.
The girl she meets is the key to a big, exciting treasure hunt, in which they meet treasure hunters from all over USA.
It's a sweet yet simple story of their journey together, with new meetings, and discovery, be it new sights, or discovering their own emotions and feelings.

Characters: Like I already stated above, the two main characters are fairly "generic", I don't really want to call them that as they are good, and I wouldn't have them any other way, but I can't think of a better word as they are pretty normal.
But like I said, I wouldn't have them any other way, normal doesn't equal bad, sometimes it's actually the better choice.
Side characters are harder to touch upon without spoilers so will leave those out for now.

Art: The sprites are what you'd expect really, they look really good, that's about it.
They have enough sprites for facial expression to show enough emotions for the characters to make up for no voice acting lending a hand in that department.
The CG art is where things really start shining though, most of them are beautiful, seriously.
A lot of the CG art is mildly animated, like light shining on to them pulsates, or flickering of fire, things like that.
This game has some of the most nice looking CG I've seen, I'd even set them as the background for my computer.
Same with the background for the scenes, really nice looking, I can't tell how "authentic" they are to the real sights as I've never been to the places these girls travel to, but they are nice looking none the less.

Sound: This game has no voice acting, but don't let that stop you from buying this VN, the sweet story makes up for it.
The background music is soothing, this is one of the few VN's where I actually have the music running.
And the ending song is just, so good, I could see me playing that kind of music all the time, if I knew what genre it was.
The system sounds, the sound of the car was "smooth" enough to not distract, but I suggest turning down the system audio, as you'll be hearing the car sound fairly often.
Other system sounds, like crowds, they were annoying enough to make it feel "real", which I find is a good thing, I don't really like VN's with bad system audio, I guess most VN devs don't think people care about it.

Writing: Though it had a few small errors, be it grammar errors, mispelled words, or even a few missing words, it's still good.
It had just the right amount of explanation for various things, wasn't too much where it feels like you're getting bombarded with information, but there was enough so you weren't left wondering what it is they're talking about.
And the puns, oh god the puns, and the geezer jokes.
I'll admit, some made me chuckle, but I could feel Marina's pain when Amber just had to crack a geezer joke.


All in all, a great VN, it's really cute and sweet, while it has it's downsides, that mostly come in the form of errors in writing such as grammar mistakes.
The characters, story and funny conversations make up for that.

I don't like scoring games, so this is what I will leave you with; A fan of yuri will thoroughly enjoy this VN, if you're not a fan then, does it sound at all appealing? Give it a test run, you can always refund it.

24473389.review:
I stumbled upon this game on pure happenstance, and was initially very skeptical of it; since Western VNs have been very hit-or-miss in their writing, themes and quality.

I'm happy to say my skepticism was completely unfounded, and that the writing here is some of the most well thought out, fleshed out, and mature I've seen in any VN, be it Western or Japanese.

What sets this particular story apart from most Yuri VNs is the fact that it takes its Western influence and runs with it, taking American themes, landscape, geography, and culture into the story itself, and doing it in a way that doesn't detract at all from the very focused picture of the story regarding Amber and Marina (the main duo in the story) or the long, rather eventful drive across the american southwest. 

the overarching story doesn't at all get away from the very strong and very real themes the VN tries to represent. These themes include, but are not limited to: mourning, loss, coming of age, family, legacy, and of course, relationships.

The most touching and important themes in the VN come from a lot of the inner-monologuing of the main character and narrator, Amber, as she deals with the loss of her grandfather, and a set of events she finds herself in, including meeting the other main in the story, Marina. The monologuing is never hamfisted, and tends to be very introspective, realistic, and will without doubt have you thinking of your current, or past relationships.

Another great plus to note is the soundtrack, which punctuates the strong, emotional and even comedic themes very well, all while being true to the American theme and setting the story finds itself in.

The weak points of the story lie in some of the 'wish fulfillment' aspects of how the story unfolds,with situations that are slightly too good to be true, but the pacing, and the more important personal relationships of the characters relegate this concern to a minor niggle.

All in all, the VN is definitely a triumph for the Yuri genre, and for Western VNs and definitely worth picking up for anyone who enjoys a good, thoughtful interpersonal story, and who's probably sick of replaying Sono Hanabira for the 30th time.

I quite enjoy visual novels, and kinetic novels (visual novels without choices), particularly of the yuri type, so this did draw my eye, but what really attracted me to this was that the game was about traveling in the US, which is uncommon, to say the least, for VNs (and KNs(.  

This is a short but sweet yuri KN, with some replayability (new modes that add a bit of humorous fun are unlocked after finishing the story).  I could go down the line with what I like and don't like, but many others have done that.  I just feel that this is truly worth the buy, as it really got me in the heart.  The music was used perfectly to augment the scenes, the characters each felt interesting enough that they could carry the story (primarily the MC and her Rival character), and the fact that this story is just full of heart.  

This is good for fans and newbies to both VNs and KNs, and I could not more heartily recommend it.

24404369.review:
[h1]概要[/h1]
　いわゆる「百合」ジャンルのビジュアルノベル。女の子と女の子のラブストーリーです。海外のこうした界隈ではもう"Yuri"で通じるようです。あくまで「百合」なので、ジェンダーとかマイノリティといった難しい話は必要のない世界のお話です。
　舞台はアメリカ南西部。わけあって一人、亡くなった祖父の形見のモーターホーム(キャンピングカー)を走らせているAmber(茶色のショートヘアの娘)。彼女が砂漠を走るハイウェイで車が動かなくなり助けを求めているMarina(サイドテールの娘)を助けたことから物語は始まります。
　それから、わけあって二人で旅をすることとなり、ゴールドラッシュ時代の埋蔵金騒動に巻き込まれて、様々な場所を巡り、様々な人々に出会いながら旅を続けていきます。いわゆる「ロードムービー」と呼ばれるストーリーの形式です。
　人づき合いが苦手で少々ぶっきらぼうな感じのAmberと、明るく人懐っこいMarinaという対照的な性格の二人が旅していく間に徐々に互いのことを知り、分かり合い、そしていつしか恋に落ちていくという、いわば「ガール・ミーツ・ガール」というべきお話です。時折シリアスな展開はありますが、基本的に甘いラブコメ的なストーリーです。

[h1]ゲームシステムについて[/h1]
　ゲームのシステムとしてはごく一般的なビジュアルノベルですが、選択肢は全く存在せず、ひたすら物語を鑑賞する紙芝居形式です。ボイスやアニメーションは残念ながらありません。対応言語は現在のところ英語のみとなっています。
　操作ついて悩むところは全くないと思います。なお、イベントスチル(イベント発生時などに表示される一枚絵)の鑑賞用メニューはゲーム開始時にはありませんが、エンディングを迎えるとメニューが表示されるようになっています。
　プレイ時間は5～10時間が目安とのことですが、私は辞書を引くことが多かったので10時間以上かけて楽しみました。英和辞書の必要な人は、登場人物かなりくだけた言い回しの英語を使うのでスラングまで載っている辞書を用意した方が良いかと思います。

[h1]ゲーム設定について[/h1]
　ゲームをクリアすると新しく"Goofball Mode"というものが選択できるようになります。この設定をオンにすると、本編にちょこちょこ悪戯的な演出の入ったり、台詞が改変されているバージョンをプレイできます。これを設定するとゲームのタイトルロゴが"HIGH SPEED FLOWER BLOOM"に変ります。このモードがあまり自分の趣味に合わないと感じたら、メインメニューに戻ってオフにすれば、ゲームを最初からやり直すことなく通常のモードでプレイできます。タイトルロゴが"HIGHWAY BLOSSOMS"に戻っていれば通常モードです。個人的な感想としては、正直なところ3周目くらいに遊ぶのが丁度良いような内容です。
　また、新しくゲームを始める時に"NORMAL"モードの他に"EZ Mode"というものが選べるようになります。これは少なくとも本編を2～3周くらい終らせてからプレイすることをお勧めします。

[h1]差分パッチについて[/h1]
　最近では、Steamの表現規制に抵触する恐れのある箇所がゲームにある場合、Steamからは該当箇所を削除したバージョンを配信し、自主規制部分を復元する差分のパッチを別途Steam外のサーバで配布するという方法が取られるケースがビジュアルノベルなどのゲームで増えています。このゲームでも同様の処置がなされています。パッチの入手方法や適用方法などについては以下のスレッドに開発者からの投稿がありますのでそちらを参照してください。作業は、ダウンロードしたファイルを所定のフォルダに配置するだけの簡単なものです。
　いったい何を言っているのかさっぱり分からない人のために遠回しな言い方をやめると、おっぱい見たいならパッチを当てろ、ということです。( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Content Restoration Patch
http://steamcommunity.com/app/451760/discussions/0/358415206085893872/

　なお、Steam実績のうち「( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)」を獲得するためには、このパッチを当てることが必要です。

[h1]感想[/h1]
　非常に楽しめました。点数としては11/10以上。とにかくMarinaちゃんが見た目だけじゃなくて、喋りや動きなんかも全部含めてかわいいので、それだけでも十分満足できました。Amberちゃんがデレデレになっていくのも納得できます。若干、御都合主義的な展開もありますが、この物語世界においてその辺りを追及するのは野暮というものです。
　もったいないと感じたのはゲーム中に一切の選択肢がないこと。作中では車に乗っている時間が長いので、その間に無駄なおしゃべりをして、助手席のMarinaちゃんを笑わせたり、喜ばせたり、からかってみたりして反応を楽しむことができたらと思うのですがそうした選択肢は一切ないのが残念です。作中ではそういったシーンは意外と少ないのでなおさらです。
　ゲームエンジンは、最近目にすることの多いフリーの"Ren'Py"を使用しているようです。演出が巧みでフリーのエンジンでここまで出来るのかと関心しました。
　シナリオもグラフィックも音楽も演出もトータルで非常に高いレベルなので自信を持ってお勧めできます。

24307135.review:
the gayest road trip.  

Seriously, for lacking any interactivity besides pressing the space bar, it's quite absorbing.  Worth the price for fans of any of the following: Kinetic VNs, romance, lesbians, the American Southwest or  hella well-made music (worth the asking price, as well as the song used over the credits)
Small criticism can be levelled at the inconsistency of the secondary art, the CG scenes are fairly less quality than the slide-by-slide art, and there are a few typos still scattered around.  Otherwise, well-rounded leads, kickass soundtrack, and jokes and angst enough for the running time make this a worthwhile read for anyone seeking to burn some time on a a cute road trip.

24268487.review:
First, a note before I leave my review. Devs, if you're reading this, I love Linda. She made me laugh out loud while playing this game. That's about 500+ brownie points in my book.

And now onto the review!

Before anyone goes "Where are the choices? This isn't a game!" You're right. This isn't. This is a Kinetic Novel.

Or as I like to call it, a comic with small bits of simple animation.

That being said, the story is both very sweet in a romantic sense, but also covers adventure, exploration, and loss. If you like your lesbians to be a piping hot cup of treasure hunters, followed by a side car of angst and a spoonful of cute so sweet you could rot your teeth.

24206121.review:
Absolutely amazing!!   At first I kind of found myself wishing that this was Life is Strange part 2 where Max and Chloe stole Frank's van and took off to the American West.

But, the more I read the story the more Amber and Marina grew in their own right. I simply adore the characters. They show true growth and I enjoyed Amber's soul searching at the end, and the ending was perfect. I will say that in order to have character growth, you have to tolerate that Amber is a little bossy and immature at first. But, that makes what happens later all the more enjoyable. 

This delivers on everything it promises, it may not involve choices but you have a wonderful journey through a very interesting setting with characters you grow to love. Well worth the money. If you want you can easily get more "adult" content.  But I really enjoyed the story as it was. I wish Steam would take down all the silly age restriction stuff. 

Much better than being told your choices will matter when they won't, growing to really like chracters to only see them (and you) get scr**ed over at the end, watching writers struggle with stupid time travel tropes only to fall in line with them at the end, and no cheap mental break mazes where dialog is looped in and reused from prior scenes. Oh, and the only bottles have cheap beer in them and they get drunk and tossed around. No stupid made up tasks to round them up so you can shoot them. 

But, don't buy this VN for what it isn't, buy it for what it is!   A wonderful story of two people who meet, have some crazy adventures, meet odd and intersting characters, and get to enjoy life and be happy. Yes, it is all about the Journey, and this is a wonderful one!

24191250.review:
Eine überraschend gute Visual Novel für wenig Geld. Ich war mir zuerst nicht ganz sicher, was mich erwarten würde. 
Aber letztendlich war das Spiel immerhin so gut, dass ich sicherlich 3/4 davon an einem Tag durchgelesen habe. 
Dinge, die mir besonders an dem Spiel gefallen haben waren zum Beispiel, dass sehr viele Hintergründe gezeichnet wurden. Ich habe glaube ich in keiner VN soviele Szenarienwechsel erleben dürfen. Auch gab es einige Nebencharaktere, welche wohlgemerkt hin und wieder sogar älter als 30 Jahre zu sein schienen. Sieht man selten. 
Mein Lieblingscharakter ist Amber, ihr Charakterdesign ist schlicht, aber es gefällt mir ziemlich gut. Vor allem dieser eine Blick, den sie öfters verwendet, finde ich großartig. Auch ihre Persönlichkeit gefällt mir, wenngleich Amber gegen Ende etwas...seltsam wird. Ambers und Marinas Persönlichkeiten wirklich zusammen sehr dynamisch. Die beiden erinnern mich an Ritona und Selphine aus Fault, wobei diese Charakterarchetypen ja oft zusammen verwendet werden. Ich hätte mir gewünscht, hätte man Marina noch etwas mehr Charaktertiefe gegeben. z.B. wurden zwei Fragen nicht in der VN beantwortet, welche ihr zusätzlich Tiefe hätten geben können.
Spoiler: Einmal, warum sie unbedingt auf Schatzsuche gehen wollte und dann, was sie Amber kaufen wollte.

Die VN gibt es nur in Englisch, was für mich aber kein Hinderniss darstellte. Die Texte sind nicht zu komplex und konnten auch gut überflogen werden. Nur die Tagebucheinträge habe ich einfach übersprungen. Es war mir zuviel Text und es wurde danach eh noch einmal alles von Amber zusammengefasst. Weshalb sich also bemühen? xD
Insgesamt ist es eher eine leichtherzig-witzige Visual Novel, welche ich nur empfehlen kann. 

Spoiler:
Der Bonusmodus war schon etwas seltsam, aber witzig.
Und ich fand die Idee recht innovativ, dass Amber ihren *&!§ vorgetäuscht hat, um Marina nicht zu verletzen. Wann findet man schon so etwas realistisches in einer Geschichte? xD

During the Steam Sale I looked for some anime games to "play". I found this, "Highway Blossoms". Since I already read some Yuri Manga, I decided to buy it. It's my first Visual Novel, and I will let you know in a short review how i think about it.

[h1] Story [/h1]
I love the story so much because its something different since it takes place in the Southwest.
Amber, a ninteen years old girl, is driving with her motorhome to a music festival. She meets Marina, a cute eighteen years old girl but the problem is, Marina's car is stolen. Marina lets Amber know about a treassure so Amber decides to give Marina a ride to search for it. 

[h1] Characters [/h1]
I like the Characters very much. Every Character was different and i nearly liked every one of them becuase they are very lovely designed. 

[h1] Visual/Audio [/h1]
The Visual Novel is very nice animated/drawn. If you compare it to other Visual Novels on Steam, you will realise that its nearly one of the best on Steam. You can play it for sure in Fullscreen without losing quality (HD). Oh gawd i liked the audio in the background so much.. you just had so much feels only because of the music. Just nearly cried at some moments. The song in the end was very lovely so please dont skip the credits.

[h1] To sum up [/h1]
I would surely rate this Visual Novel 9/10 if not even 10/10. I will read it a second time, because you get more options to read since you finished it once. Its just sad to know that its over, because you just have so much feelings during reading. If you are not sure to buy it JUST BUY IT and give it a try. And dont forget to install the adult patch, for the sex scenes.

24120912.review:
So, I found this game under the new games section and as a lesbian the yuri content really spoke to me. Besides that I usually am not a big fan of visual novels, including the fact that this game is more of a kinetic novel, because you don't make choices yourself, you just sit back and take in the story. I wasn't sure first, but while I was putting all the games into my cart in summer sale I was like "why the hell not" (it was -15% too). Surprisingly this is the first game I played after the summer sale and i totally didn't regret it, even though it was a wise idea to play it at night with everybody asleep if you know what I mean! 
First of all it's logical that this game kinda speaks to me with the homosexual protagonist, so there was a reason I should at least enjoy this game a bit (which I totally did!). 
I am not experienced with visual novels, but i think the game and gameplay is kept quite simple, which doesn't bother if you've got nothing against some reading and sinking into the story.
I DID sink into the story a lot, it's really nice and cute and so funny, i can't tell how many times I had to pull myself together not bursting into laughter afraid of waking up my parents! I got really attached to the characters, which made me kinda sad to see it end. The game took be about 8 hours to finish it. I also love the soundtrack, it gives everything the right mood! I especially love the acoustic guitar tracks, made me feel 'dem feels. And also the artwork is super lovely, kept taking screenshots even though you get a gallery after finishing it.
To sum it up in a very subjective way, the game is so lovely and funny it is really worth playing it when you are into yuri! So if you are ready to enjoy a nice short and emotional ride on the yuri motorhome on some good ol' american highways then just go for it!

Welcome to the cross-country feels trips. 


Adorable at times, frustrating at others (in the smack sense into Amber way for being dumb about things), with a half-deent, if inplausible plot that showcases a few of the landmarks around the south-eastern corner of 'Murica, this cute littlegame has some adorable and likeable characters, and one who seems to not realize how to wear her clothes properly but its okay and easy to forgive her because she looks nice. 

You don't come to the game for the actual plot. Its fairly minor and just there as a skeleton that all the character-development and feelings hang onto and give them a reason to go about doing things. But, its not so terrible as to bring down the score I'd give the game.

24069929.review:
During the Steam Sale I mass bought a bunch of VNs and Highway Blossoms was easily the best.

The characters were relatable and interesting. Even the tertiary characters managed to be very memorable.

The relationship was believable because the story took its time instead of just jumping into it. Although this came at the cost of blue balling the reader at least 4 times, pehaps more depending on who you ask.

There aren't any choices that lead to multiple endings or anything but there really didn't need to be. The story is already quite long and entertaining.

Also the music was quite good had a spaghetti western feel to it which I liked. Reminded me of a movie that liked when I was a kid. Can't remember the name of it sadly.

But the very best part was the lack of weeb pandering. It takes place in the American Southwest and doesn't mention Japan once and that is a breath of fresh air.

There were a couple of minor things that niggled at me while I played. I thought the MC was around age 23 when she was introduced but it turns out she's 19 and they even directly address that she seems older than she is which kind of bugged me. Also the MC never specifically mentions she's a lesbian. I do actually kind of like how they didn't make a big deal out of it and you can figure it out by yourself pretty quick by the way she checks out nearly every woman she encounters. But still one sentence saying "I never was into boys." or something to that effect would have been nice.

The biggest weakness of the story though would have to be that it tries to be sad at times but it's REALLY bad at it. I'd give detail but I don't really want to spoil anything. I'm a sucker for tearjerking moments and stuff too, so for me not to be phased it must mean a lot.

Still definetely worth the buy. I got it during a sale but I would have gotten it at full price just to support the people who made it.
